results.description:
(scenic road run not trail)


Meet at:  Meet in front of info booth-restrooms (click on address above to see map) 

Let's warm up together, then go at your own pace and distance. All abilities are welcome.  Partner into pace groups as needed! 

Join us for a scenic run/ brisk walk by the Hudson River.  Let's practice together by the river -- because it's hard for city dweller-trail runners to get to the trail all the time. Route features Hudson River Greenway and the Highline. Rain, snow or shine. Heavy rain/snow cancels.

Who: Runners, runners of all abilities, run-walkers, guests are welcome! Form pace groups/partner as needed. 

Facilities: bike racks at start, water fountains turned off for winter, public restrooms at Pier 45 and on Highline: by Whitney museum and Abington House near 30th.

Route

• Start Pier 45

• Go from Pier 45 to Pier 26, south bound, via Hudson River Greenway and boardwalk  (~.8 mile, warm up)

• Turn around at Pier 26 and go north bound to Whitney (~.1.3 miles)

• By Whitney museum, enter Highline 

• Continue on Highline, north bound  (~1 mile. It's usually 1.45 mi. to end, but part of it is currently closed, at 30th and railyards for construction until "March 11.")

• Go south on Highline   (1 mi.)

Proceed to Chelsea Market for brunch
*or*  

Return to start-finish at Pier 45  (.5 mi.)

Total = ~ 4.1 miles  (or ~4.6 if you return to start) 


Brunch (optional):  Proceed to brunch! Friends and family are welcome.

At  Chelsea Market, 75 9th Ave, New York, NY. Map.

Weather:  New York, NY

Comments? Post in comments section below. 

Happy running!

http://i1.wp.com/brokensidewalk.com/wp-content/uploads/2009/07/hudson_river_park_06.jpg?resize=800%2C555

Photo: Tribeca boardwalk, Hudson River Park, via Broken Sidewalk

Photo: Run on the Highline (fall), NYC, by Rosanna B.


____________

*  This is not an organized training program. This is just a notice of a run some people are doing, sent out to those who might want to join them. Each person is solely responsible for oneself, and for following trail etiquette, laws, park rules, and park safety guidelines. Thanks.

This group's content is available only to members.
results.name: Easy Sunday on the Highline + brunch

results.description:
NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES @RIVERSIDE PARK

                                      Check our Facebook page:

                   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                             NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

</a>

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nzhrn3ldY4U

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 9:00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S. 

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                       <a href="http://www.yelp.com/biz/lions-head-tavern-new-york">Lion’s Head Tavern 

                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Come join us for some challenging Rock Scrambling and Crevice Exploration at Mohonk Preserve and put your Rock Scrambling skills to the test! Though the mileage is short, this is no average walk in the park!  You will get a full body workout while exploring the many crevices, towering rock walls and breakdown of the "Lost City".

Please Note: Although most of the area is thawed out, we will encounter some small amounts of residual ice in some of the crevices. I scouted it out this past weekend and we should be able to navigate the icy portions safely without microspikes. Please note that extra care will be needed during this transitional time of the year.

WE WILL MEET AT THE COXING TRAILHEAD @ MOHONK PRESERVE

807 Clove Rd

Gardiner, NY

[masked], [masked]


http://www.mohonkpreserve.org/coxing-trailhead

Our adventure at Lost City: The trail in to Lost City is approx 1 mile.  The majority of our time will be spent at the cliff base in the scrambles and climbs of the "Lost City". With the East facing cliffs we will take advantage of the morning sun. There are also some small dark crevices to explore for the more adventurous so be sure to bring a headlamp!


TOTAL DISTANCE: Approximately 3-4 miles

SCRAMBLING PACE: Slow but physically challenging (not to be confused with easy)

ESTIMATED HIKE/SCRAMBLE TIME: 4-5 hours

DIFFICULTY: Advanced Beginner / Intermediate - Rocky Terrain & Crevices with possible loose, slippery or jagged rocks. Must have a good sense of balance and not have an unnatural fear of heights

CURRENT WEATHER FORECAST: Cloudy with a high of 57 degrees. Please Note: the temperatures will be cooler in some of the crevices so bring a layer to take on/off as needed.

FEE: Please Note Mohonk Preserve charges a $12. fee for day use.  Season Passes are also available for $55. or $45. for students.  If you enjoy Mohonk preserve you can apply your $12. day usage fee towards the purchase of a membership by simply saving and submitting your bracelet (pass) within 2 weeks of purchase at the Visitor Center.


RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Climbing Helmet (Bicycle helmet will do) Not mandatory but rocks could get kicked loose (especially recommended for people with minimal scrambling experience or those that have lots of money invested in their brains)

• Raincoat/Windbreaker or long sleeve thermal for crevices

• "Scrambling" Gloves - Lightweight with good grip - Gardening gloves from Home Depot work great!

• Shoes with good grip - preferably with ankle support

• Headlamp with spare batteries - Home Depot has a great 100 lumen headlamp for only $12.99!

• A Small Pack - nothing too large that will become a hindrance in the scrambles

• Related maps, a Compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.


RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set


**HEAVY RAIN WILL CANCEL THIS EVENT**


NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER
Waiver of liability

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.


The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.


This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.


Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

Here are the details of the anti-Ringling demonstration:

TIME: 10:00am - 11:30am
Point Person: Richard - cell #[masked]-5302...

Saturday March 12, 6:00 - 8:00 pm

Sunday, March 13, 10:00 - 11:30 am

Sunday March 13, 2:00 - 4:00 pm

Sunday March 13, 6:00 - 8:00 pm

Please help FAUN and our friends/allies stand up for animals enslaved by the heartless, horrific enterprise known as Ringling Bros Circus. Animals are enslaved, abused and forced to spend their dismal, horrendous lives engaging in behaviors wholly unnatural to them, performing under constant threat of pain and punishment by this ravenous cash machine of a "circus". and get treated like garbage even as those who survive all the horror, a joyless life of mechanistic use and abuse, approach convalescence.

Again, we will have signs, leaflets and relevant props. If you have something you want to bring, that's fine, but all you NEED to bring is YOURSELF, a heart full of empathy/compassion and a voice to demonstrate your love for pachyderms,primates, bears, big cats, all creatures great and small.

blessed be ALL animals, FIGHT for their rights!!

Curious about how to add interactivity to websites using Javascript? Join us for an intensive one-day crash course where you’ll be immersed in the language through a mixture of brief lectures and programming exercises.


This course is perfect for aspiring developers or entrepreneurs with no technical experience or those looking to get a refresher in JavaScript. 

What You'll Learn: 

• Learn how to use JavaScript in the browser and how to add interactivity. 

• Learn about the DOM and how to traverse it.

• Learn how to use APIs to add real world data to your applications.

• Learn about common best practices for using the language.

• Learn how to work with the Chrome Inspector and JavaScript console to debug your code

Logistics:

Date: Sunday March 13, 2016

Time: 10:30 am - 4:30 pm 

Price: $125 (Purchase Tickets Here)

Prerequisites:

• Laptop Computer + Charger 

• Download Sublime Text and Google Chrome on your machine

This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

Coach Frank

results.description:
Please join us for today’s service led by special guest speaker, Rev. Craig Hirshberg. What are the assumptions we hold onto as we move toward a more just society … and what are some of the assumptions we need to dispel.  Join Rev. Craig Hirshberg, Exec. Director of the Unitarian Universalist Legislative Ministry, as she explores the foundations and the myths of social justice work and how the UU Legislative Ministry of NJ addresses them.

Rev. Craig Hirshberg’s Bio:

Rev. Hirshberg currently serves as the Executive Director of the Unitarian Universalist Legislative Ministry of New Jersey (UULMNJ), representing Unitarian Universalist congregations throughout New Jersey.  UULMNJ strives to be a courageous, compassionate, non-partisan voice for truth, justice and equality in New Jersey public policy, working in collaboration with like-minded organizations through education, research, advocacy, witness, and service. Rev. Hirshberg believes that public advocacy is a necessary component of any spiritual practice.

Rev. Craig Hirshberg came to the Legislative Ministry in May 2011 with a wealth of experience in the pulpit and in the community. She is Minister Emerita of the UU Congregation of Somerset Hills where she served as the founding minister.  She brought to her ministry extensive non-profit experience including training, planning, community organizing and program development.  She has a private practice in spiritual direction and hosts meditation classes, retreats and other spiritual development activities.  She is a graduate of Drew Theological School, and a lifelong student at the Barre Center for Buddhist Studies. She received her spiritual direction training at Shalem in Washington DC.  Rev. Hirshberg also serves on the Unitarian Universalist Association’s Trauma Response Team, being deployed in the aftermath of Hurricanes Katrina and Sandy.

Following the service: “Belief: In Justice, In Love” with Rev. Craig Hirshberg, there will be a short session led by Frances Prestianni and Lessie Culmer-Nier of the UU Legislative Ministry of NJ, “How to Make a Better World – One Law at a Time”.  How the Legislative Ministry works with Q&A.
results.name: Belief: In Justice, In Love

We meet every Sunday morning at 11:00 for Cinema & Discussion-$ 8 per movie- Village East Cinema- (2nd Ave btwn 11th & 12th ) Occasionally we will go instead around the corner to Loews at 66 3rd Ave-depending on whats playing. (There are also foreign films & documentaries)- After the movie we go to a Coffee shop to discuss the movie. I can be reached by text at[masked] or email at [masked]. feel free to come even if you dont RSVP.

The movie choices will be posted in the comments section Thursday morning for a group vote

Thank You,

Sal Blech
results.name: Movies & Coffee- NYC- Sunday Mornings

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.
results.how_to_find_us: behind the USS Maine Monument (gold statue)
results.name: Sunday Central Park Runs

group.name: I wanted to do that...Just not alone!!

results.description:
Note that the date has changed to Sunday, rather than our usual Saturday meetup time.

Feynman called it "this dippy process". Quantum Field Theories are plagued with divergences...particularly ultra-violet divergences arise from the very short-range interactions, including self-interactions, in pertabative expansions of the interacting theory. Yet  a methodology has been developed to regulate such divergences, a process called Renormalization.

We will begin by deriving the Feynman Rules using the Path Integral Formalism and the generating functional of the free Klein-Gordan field.  We add to it a quartic interaction term and see how the Feynman Rules are changed.

Then Amol will discuss Renormalization...how one regulates the loop divergences using a prescriptive technique which deals with variations of physical quantities across contiguous scales. The justification of this method  is in the pudding: quantum field theory has been enormously successful in predicting the scattering amplitudes of particle interactions.

The best references are Peskin and Schroeder Chapter 9.1 - 9.3, or Ryder Cchapter 6, But for a good introduction to Path Integral quantization, you may reference the following:

http://bolvan.ph.utexas.edu/~vadim/classes/2012f/fq.pdf

We will try to keep the math (admittedly pretty intense) to a minimum, so a high level understanding of the principles involved  should be sufficient.

Hope to see you there!

Barry
results.name: Taming the Infinities: Renormalization of Quantum Field Theories

venue.name: New York Society for Ethical Culture

results.description:
http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/w583h583_95192-characteristics-of-demagoguery.jpg?itok=BrfonjKN Leader  Joseph Chuman

Dr. Anne Klaeysen, Leader presides 

Not since the McCarthy era have we seen political demagoguery issuing from such high places. We witness the politics of fear fueled by scapegoating minorities and immigrants, especially Latinos and Muslims for the sake of winning the votes of individuals who feel disenfranchised and left behind in light of demographic, economic and social upheavals.

This demagoguery, is fearsome and dangerous, (even the mainline press has invoked the word "fascism" to describe it.)  The extremism we experience is rooted in the so-called culture wars, which in the broadest sense pit conservatives and ultra-conservatives against a social landscape that is moving generally in a liberal direction. In my address of March 13th I  want to not only speak out against demagoguery which assails us, but look at its source and reasons for hope that we can get beyond it.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.
results.how_to_find_us: Ceremonial Hall
results.name: Sunday Meeting: Culture Wars, Demagoguery and the Search for Hope

results.description:
Are you interested in your code having a larger impact than your personal projects or your job? Have you been interested in participating in open source, but never knew how to start? This workshop is going to be focused on getting everyone who attends to make their first contributions to open source Ruby projects. All levels of Ruby experience are welcome!

Prerequisites

• Bring a laptop and charger (if you don't have one, you can pair with someone)
• Install Ruby 2+
• Install PostgreSQL (or we do it here if you run into issues)
• Create a GitHub account (if you don't already have one)
• Download GitHub Desktop, and go through the Tutorial under the Help menu (unless you are already comfortable with Git)

Mentors

If you are experienced in Ruby and open source contribution and would be interested in mentoring, please get in touch: [masked]. We doing all of the planning in a Google Doc, so if you have suggestions of good projects (or better yet, specific issues), please add them there!

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SLhdNQgUXnle9Xwib0omTJEG-roXaF6QQY7qzjog7WM/edit#

Other info

Space, snacks, and drinks are being graciously provided by thoughtbot.

We are anticipating high demand for this event, so are charging a nominal fee to ensure those who RSVP actually intend to be there. All proceeds will go towards Meetup group fees. Please only RSVP if you can stay for the whole time.

Let us know in the comments if you have any questions. If you can't make it, don't worry, we plan to do more in the future. Looking forward to seeing you Sunday!
results.name: First-Time Open Source Contributor Workshop [Ruby-Focused­­]

results.description:
Join StoryForward NYC on Sunday, March 13th for the first in our Storytelling Workshop Series. 

Each workshop in the series will provide a valuable hands-on learning experience with some of the newest and most popular tools designed to increase productivity, manage teams, maximize brainstorming sessions and provide legal support for independent creators.

This month's workshop will feature the project management system, Trello. In this workshop, you’ll learn how to use Trello for your story telling workflow; from brainstorming and storyboarding, to managing teams and project deliverables.

Come prepared to engage; we recommend a laptop or tablet for a true hands-on experience.

The workshop will be led by Trello Interaction Designer, Bobby Grace. Bobby has designed, developed, and written for Trello since the beginning. 

ABOUT TRELLO:

Trusted by millions, Trello is a visual collaboration tool that creates a shared perspective on any project. Trello’s boards, lists and cards enable you to organize and prioritize your personal and work life in a fun, flexible, and rewarding way.

Coffee and juice will be provided.
results.name: Storytelling Tools Workshop: Maximizing your Efficiency with Trello

results.description:
In this workshop, Jessica will teach you the basics of creating your very own cold-process soap. As the oldest method used to create a soap, cold process remains the front-runner in organic soap-making. In short, it is the act of saponifying water and oil to create glycerin, which is a natural humectant.

You will learn how to formulate a well balanced recipe using essential oils, clays, and herbs to create a custom blend especially for you. You will be exposed to the incredibly vast benefits of using organic, non-processed products on your skin, leaving you with enough knowledge to walk away and experiment with different formulas and variations of your own. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/xC4O9q
results.name: Organic Soap Making Class!

results.description:
For kids 7 years & up - free, but you must register in advance:
http://beamcenter.org/2016-festival-registration

Beam Center will put kids’ hands on the levers of natural phenomena in a big collaborative project, workshops and demonstrations at its seventh annual Inventgenuity Festival. As it does in its public school collaborations, camps, and afterschool programs, Beam Center blends art, science and imagination at this popular annual winter celebration of making things, this year at a new location, PS32/MS442 in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn.

In this year's Festival Project, the Mechanical Marsh, (designed by sculptor Andrew Brehm) kids will construct real and imagined mechanical birds that will appear to take flight in a large-scale kinetic sculpture-scape. Participation in the project is free as are demonstrations that will include presentations fromDBA Arcade Cabinets, Nerdy Derby, and Gerb’s Garage. Attendees may also sign-up for one of the rotating slate of 45-minute workshops. Scheduled workshops with Beam Center faculty will explore the NATURAL MACHINERY theme: through making Thaumatropes (Alex Nathanson), Color Wheels (Elizabeth Hurst), Omnivorous Plants (Jaimie Warren), Balancing Sculptures (Brett Van Aalsburg), Wooden Snakes (Mitchell Dose) and more. The Festival will also feature several of the large-scale projects that the Beam Center faculty has collaborated on with NYC public school students and teachers: Funktions: algebraic visualization screen (Fannie Lou Hamer Freedom High School), Digital Poetry Machine: a word board that uses the Twitter API (Brooklyn International High School), Wall of Boomboxes (MS 442).
results.name: Build Mechanical Birds at the Inventgenuity Festival

results.description:
We often feel an instinctive sympathy for the plight of others—and a corresponding desire to alleviate their suffering. But what do we do with that sympathy? How do we reconcile it with feeling overwhelmed by the ills of the world? How much of ourselves can we in good conscience give to people who suffer on the other side of the planet, when there is so much to do in our own communities? Is it even responsible to try to intervene in injustice happening so far away? These questions are some of the defining struggles of our present moment. Activist Grace Patterson will argue that we can start to answer them by doubling down on the compassion that spurs them.

Grace Patterson is a nontheist, a Unitarian Universalist, and a committed interfaith advocate and writer. As the Director of Global Programs for World Faith, she supports religiously diverse teams of young people around the world who are working to end religious violence and global poverty. As the Director of Strategy for Mean Communications, she works with interfaith organizations to help craft and execute communications strategies that will compel others to join, create, and do. She has written about all this and more for Mic.com, State of Formation, and extensively in her own personal journal.
results.name: Sunday Platform: Compassion Is Not a Zero Sum Game

results.description:
In honor of Women's History Month, join us for a talk about Mary Peabody  Mann. 

You’ve probably heard of Horace Mann, but maybe not much about his wife, Mary Peabody Mann. She’s worth consideration as a figure of history in her own right, and contributed to progressive education. She wrote about the ethical development of early childhood. A Women’s History Month talk by our Leader, Jone Johnson Lewis. 

For more information: http://www.rysec.org/event/mary-peabody-mann

results.description:
Folks, 
Inviting volunteers to join me at the St Xaviers Church Soup Kitchen on Sunday to serve over 1000 meals to the poor and homeless provided by St Xaviers Pantry.

This is based on the values that we would treat everyone equal,trustworthy, with dignity without any discrimination. We also want to be socially inclusive, including everyone with their preferences, culture and celebrate diversity. We will serve vegetarian dishes. The Soup Kitchen is dependent on volunteers to help work towards sustaining these values our community. If you are interested in being a volunteer, rsvp through this page. You don't have to be particularly skillful, we believe that if you have the passion, that's all that's needed :)


Soup Kitchen provides the aprons, gloves, hairnets. (one can wear their own baseball hat). Long hair need to be tied back unless it all fit in the hair net. We work with you, show you what to do. Please wear something comfortable.

Type of help could vary from coordinating the line, serving meals, Removing empty plates from the table or general helping out. 

Location -

 Church of St. Francis Xavier (Basement Hall)

46 W. 16th Street (Between 6th and 5th Avenue), New York, NY

Time -

11:30 - 3:30 ( You are required to stay till the end)

I will put my number on the meetup wall once we get close to the date. Members might get different responsibilities but will try to work as a group.
results.name: Vounteer At St Xavier's Church Soup Kitchen - Feed the Homeless, Good Karma!

results.description:
I love a good book club! What better way than combining a good book, good conversation, and good food? Join our first of what will hopefully be a monthly book club get together. For our first get together, we'll meet for brunch and discuss "The Restaurant Critic's Wife." Check out the review on Goodreads.com: http://www.goodreads.com/book/show/25828495-the-restaurant-critic-s-wife?from_search=true&search_version=service.

Ideally, I would love for us to have our get togethers in members' homes (on a volunteer & rotating basis) and you can feel free to bring any wine/beer/snacks you choose! 

There will be a limited amount of spots so if you RSVP, please plan on attending the event as well as purchasing a food and beverage at the restaurant. Should your plans change, please un-RSVP as soon as possible so that someone else can fill your spot. We will also have a waitlist available.  

If you have any questions or have any suggestions, feel free to message me! Until then....happy reading :)

results.description:
Folks, 
Inviting volunteers to join me at the St Xaviers Church Welcome Kitchen on Sunday to serve over 1000 meals to the poor and homeless provided by St Xaviers Pantry.

This is based on the values that we would treat everyone equal,trustworthy, with dignity without any discrimination. We also want to be socially inclusive, including everyone with their preferences, culture and celebrate diversity. We will serve vegetarian dishes. The Soup Kitchen is dependent on volunteers to help work towards sustaining these values our community. If you are interested in being a volunteer, rsvp through this page. You don't have to be particularly skillful, we believe that if you have the passion, that's all that's needed :)


Soup Kitchen provides the aprons, gloves, hairnets. (one can wear their own baseball hat). Long hair need to be tied back unless it all fit in the hair net. We work with you, show you what to do. Please wear something comfortable.

results.description:
TAKING THE SPOTLIGHT

It is important to know when to take the spotlight and when to give the spotlight to others. In this workshop we will work on really “stepping up to the plate” when it is your turn to take the spotlight, and focusing on and supporting others when it is their turn to take the spotlight.

Some actors are more comfortable in the background and some are more comfortable being the center of attention. This workshop will consist of exercises, games and scenes that will allow the performer to practice giving and taking focus and to develop comfort with both.

A fun safe and non-competitive environment is created in which each participant will learn how to work through inhibitions and tap into their imaginations.

Suggested Donation: $15*

*free drink with $15 donation

*Most improv classes in NYC cost $35-50 per session.
results.name: Taking the Spotlight

results.description:
Join professional photographer David Wells as he recounts his travels from all over the world! David will also discuss his recent trips to Morocco, one of the most visually striking locations in the world. From thoughtfully-crafted workshops in Morocco's Imperial Cities to a magical expedition to the Sahara Desert via the Atlas Mountains, this engaging presentation will be sure to inspire.

Check out our upcoming photo journey to Morocco with David!  Attend the seminar with any questions you may have for him.  Click here for more information about the adventure.


-----------

David H. Wells is a freelance documentary photographer and photo-educator based in Providence, Rhode Island. He specializes in intercultural communications and the use of light and shadow to enhance visual narratives. He has received two Fulbright fellowships, a grant from Nikon/N.P.P.A. and a fellowship from the Pennsylvania Council on the Arts. His work has been in over fifty exhibitions and he has taught workshops at the International Center for Photography in NYC and at the Maine Media Workshops. In 2011 he was featured in Photo District News as one of “The Best Workshop Instructors.”  He has exhaustive experience leading photography tours, including our last two years in Morocco to great success.
results.name: *FREE RSVP* Travel Photography Seminar + Morocco with David Wells

This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 9:45AM (2 hours before the start time)

F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

results.description:
Join The CRC and Catholic Charities of NYC to the Welcome Table at the Xavier Mission!

The Welcome Table is open every Sunday, a day when most other soup kitchens in NYC are closed, the Welcome Table serves[masked] hot meals each week. The Welcome Table strives to go beyond food by also providing guests with assistance in obtaining entitlement benefits, free chiropractic treatments, HIV testing and counseling, and voter registration drives.

There are slots available for up to fifteen volunteers to prepare and serve food in a soup kitchen. We will be serving between 11:30 a.m. to 3:30 p.m.

There’s nothing like giving back and paying forward to make you feel like you spent your day doing something worthwhile.

results.description:
Join singles from multiple Meetup groups for a private tour of MoMa with a dedicated guide to the museum's treasures!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (Must purchase ticket in advance here) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2:20 pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location emailed to address used to pay for ticket). 

We will then introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum. At 2pm we will head over to the museum together. 

Our tour guide will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own. Your ticket includes:

12pm-2:00pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - General admission to the Museum

GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM 

Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you buy ticket.  

Tour Description - 

MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

What if I'm a MoMa member? Sorry but Moma puts a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our events with the private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide.  Only individuals who purchase through our website can participate in the group tour.  

Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and/or are looking to meet new people. 

Why my RSVP says +25? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 

Can I get tickets at museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location starting at 12pm.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date

results.description:
DO NOT MISS - DO NOT MISS

LEMURS: Join trailblazing scientist Dr. Patricia Wright on her lifelong mission to help these strange and adorable creatures survive in the modern world. See will play part of the IMAX movie: Island of Lemurs: Madagascar 3D. / NYC ATHEISTS BRUNCH / MARCH 13TH (SUN.) / 12 NOON


Speaker: Dr. Patricia Wright, Distinguished Service Professor Stony Brook University

Subject: Lemurs - Earth’s Most Diverse Group of Primates - OUR OLDEST LIVING RELATIVES.

Lemurs are small primates known as "prosimians," which, roughly translated, means "pre-primates" or "before monkeys." Native only to the island of Madagascar and the neighboring Comoro Islands, lemurs resemble the oldest ancestors of primates which existed tens of millions of years ago.

Madagascar is a strange place. It’s sometimes called the 8th continent due to its unique evolution and physical isolation. Ninety percent of its wildlife is found nowhere else. With no monkeys to compete with, Madagascar’s lemurs evolved into over 100 species, from the 3.5-inch Berthe’s mouse lemur (the smallest primate in the world) to the now-extinct giant sloth lemur (which weighed as much as a gorilla). 

-------------------------


LOCATION: The Press Box Restaurant, 932 Second Avenue (bet. 49th & 50th Sts.) -2nd Floor.


 COST: BRUNCH is $20, which includes a selection of Buffet Entrees, salad, one soft drink, coffee, tax and tip.

===================================
results.how_to_find_us: 2ND FLOOR
results.name: DO NOT MISS: Ghosts of the Forest / NYCA BRUNCH / MARCH 13TH (SUN.) / 12 NOON

The Product Mentor is a program designed to pair Product Mentors and Mentees from around the World, across all industries, from start-up to enterprise, guided by the fundamental goals…

results.description:
Join Grand Central Atelier graduate Allison Parker for this three-part Portrait Drawing Intensive. (The fee includes all three dates.)

In this three-session portrait drawing intensive, students will study the basic anatomy of the skull in order to create a more three-dimensional likeness of the model. Concepts will include basic composition and gesture to set up the portrait, identifying bony landmarks of the skull, creating a ‘block-in’ or detailed outline, and using careful shading to suggest the unique forms of the portrait. Students will learn to trouble-shoot their work using basic anatomy and perspective concepts, visual comparisons, and measuring. Students are encouraged to work in graphite and white chalk on toned paper.

Day 1- Anatomy of the face, looking for composition and gesture, demo of beginning the block-in. Sunday - March 13th 12-4 pm

Day 2- Refining the block-in to create a likeness and three-dimensional outline. Sunday - March 20th 12-4 pm


Day 3- Identifying a light effect, shading demo, refining the drawing using shades and highlights. Sunday - April 3rd 12-4 pm


Instructors Work

Allison Parker completed a four-year course of study in classical drawing and painting at the Grand Central Academy. Her experience includes many hours of drawing and painting from the live model as well as ecorche´ and anatomical studies. Ms. Parker holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the Savannah College of Art and Design in Painting and Illustration. Her work has received awards from the Salmagundi Club, the New York Society of Illustrators, and American Illustration Magazine. It has been featured on television as part of the documentary ‘Secrets of New York.’ Allison is a member of Brooklyn Brush Studios in Bushwick, Brooklyn where she paints and teaches privately.

results.name: Portrait Drawing Intensive, 3-day workshop with Allison Parker

results.description:
Join singles from multiple Meetup groups for a private tour of MoMa with a dedicated guide to the museum's treasures!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (Must purchase ticket in advance here) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2:20 pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location emailed to address used to pay for ticket). 

We will then introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum. At 2pm we will head over to the museum together. 

Our tour guide will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own. Your ticket includes:

12pm-2:00pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - General admission to the Museum

GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM


Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you buy ticket. 


Tour Description -  

MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

What if I'm a MoMa member? Sorry but Moma puts a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our events with the private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide.  Only individuals who purchase through our website can participate in the group tour. 


Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and/or are looking to meet new people. 

Why my RSVP says +25? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 

Can I get tickets at museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location starting at 12pm.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM

results.description:
Prepay at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6013 

required

Moma Singles Tour with our own private tour guide. (prepay only) 

Date & Time: Sunday, March 13, 2016 
Noon 

Male ages: all 
Female ages: all 

Location: Museum of Modern Art 

Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you register.

The tour starts at 220 pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at Noon am at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own.  Your ticket includes:

12pm-2:00pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - Close- General admission to the Museum

Tour Description 
MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

*NOTE: You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:45 PM. If you arrive after 1:45 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and/or are looking to meet new people.

Prepay at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=6013

  NO DOOR RESERVATIONS

venue.name: John Ricard Studio

results.description:
This is a brand new workshop that I have put together.  It will have 2 components.

First, we will discuss any lighting or posing problems that the members of the group may have.  We will select one of these problems, and I will demonstrate how I would use lighting or posing to solve that problem.  I will ask someone from the group to model for this portion of the workshop.   By the end of this segment, you will have a good understanding of at least one lighting setup that works to solve a particular problem or shooting scenario.

Second, we will examine the website and social media feed for one of the group members.  We will discuss how this member wants to portray herself online and whether or not the website and social media do, in fact, enhance that portrayal.  We will discuss if the bio, images and look of the website convey the message that the creator of those images, would like them to convey.


Hope to see you on Sunday!  Feel free to reach out to me with any questions.

John Ricard

www.johnricard.com

results.description:
The School of Driving March location drawing event will be at Grand Central Terminal! Join us to draw at GCT on Sunday, March 13th:

*We will meet that day at GCT at 12 p.m. in the Main Concourse by the Information stand, better known as 'The Clock,' and stay until 5:30/6 p.m. 

*There will be a mid-day work share at 3:00 p.m. in the Dining Concourse on the Lower Level. The location of the mid-day meetup may be changed based on crowds. Any location changes will be announced on the group page the day of the event.

*Final crit will begin at around 5:30 p.m. that evening on the Balcony Level, unless I find a cooler spot. Again, any changes will be announced throughout the day.


Directions:

**For those of you coming from within the city: take the 4/5/6 or 7 go directly to Grand Central. After that, the closest subways are the B/D/F OR M; take one of those to Bryant Park and walk 3 blocks east.

***For those coming from Penn station, options are:

-take the 2/3 up to 42nd and transfer to the 7 towards Queens to GCT.

-take the bus (M4/Q32), but the bus sucks, so I don't recommend it

-take the 20 minute walk 

****For those of you coming from elsewhere who prefer or need to carpool, I read that there is now a Morgan Freeman voice on the Waze app.

http://www.grandcentralterminal.com/

Last month at the The Brooklyn Museum was swell and some neat pieces were created, despite our frozen fingers. We are looking forward to another day of doodle fun! If you have any further questions, please contact me. Thanks everyone and we hope to see you there!!
results.how_to_find_us: Find anyone wearing a 'Student Driver' sticker
results.name: Location Drawing @ Grand Central Terminal!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (Must purchase ticket in advance here) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM

The tour starts at 2:20 pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 12pm at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location emailed to address used to pay for ticket). 

We will then introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum. At 2pm we will head over to the museum together. 

Our tour guide will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum. Afterwards, we can explore the other great things the museum has to offer on our own. Your ticket includes:

12pm-2:00pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2:20pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:20pm - General admission to the Museum

GET TIX HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM 

Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when you buy ticket.  

Tour Description - 

MoMA guided tours are the perfect opportunities to discover the collection, in the company of an art historian.  Guided tours explore Yoshio Taniguchi's sublime architecture and then focus on the highlights of the collection showcasing works by the greatest artists from the late nineteenth century through the present. 

Your tour would include works such as Vincent van Gogh's The Starry Night, Claude Monet's Reflections of Clouds on the Water-Lily Pond, and Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans. 

What if I'm a MoMa member? Sorry but Moma puts a strict maximum as far as the number of people that can attend our events with the private tour. We are charged per person for each tour guide.  Only individuals who purchase through our website can participate in the group tour.  

Is this event age/ethnic specific? No. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be age/gender/ethnic specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and/or are looking to meet new people. 

Why my RSVP says +25? This is a multi-Meetup and we'll have up to 50 members from various groups attending. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 

Can I get tickets at museum? No. You must purchase tickets in advance for our private tour which will include the pre-mingle. You will pick up the actual tour tickets at the pre-mingle location starting at 12pm.

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/moma/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_1200PM
results.how_to_find_us: Pre-Mingle location will be sent to you after ticket is purchased, closer to event date
