results.description:
We had a good turnout at last Sunday's meetup. Lots of new players showed up and we played a full 9 inning casual but competitive fun game.

There is a $5 fee for the entire year to cover the website costs and softball equipment (balls, bases, etc). Nav will collect the money.

Also very important: if you RSVP that you are coming, please try to make it or change your RSVP before 12 PM if for any reason you can't. We have had some repeat no-shows and it makes it a lot harder to have an actual game. All are welcomed, see y'all on the field!
results.how_to_find_us: First field by the basketball courts, 86th St and 14th Ave
results.name: Sunday softball meetup ⚾️ (co-ed)

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

Full refunds will be issued only when reservations are cancelled 24 hours before start time (Saturday 12pm) AT LATEST

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING. Defenders with 2 feet inside own forbidden zone equals a penalty shot without a goalie from either opposing corner. Attackers inside opponent's forbidden zone equals loss of pocession. 


We will play 8-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Re-enbolso de su pago se permitirá solo si se cancela 24 horas antes del evento (Sabado 12pm) AL MAS TARDAR.

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 12pm y jugamos hasta las 2:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR.  Defensa con 2 pies en Zona proibida propia equivale a penal sin portero desde cualquier esquina opuesta. Atacante ingresando a zona proibida rival equivale a perdida de posesion.

Se jugaran partidos de 8 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.
results.how_to_find_us: Corner of 37th Street and 4th Avenue in Brooklyn (use 4th Avenue entrance)
results.name: Are You Ready For Some Weekend FUTSAL????

group.name: Are You Ready for Some FUTBOL!!!!!!!!!

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
We're seeing green! That means it's time to celebrate St. Patrick's Day!

As always, there will be lots of yummy treats and fun for all. Plus one lucky doxie will win a special prize in our monthly raffle - almost as good as a pot o' gold!

YOUR CONTACT INFO

Please check your e-mail and the Web site in case there are last-minute changes to this Meetup. If you would like to be notified of changes by phone, please send a contact number. If you don't hear otherwise, the Meetup is on.

DIRECTIONS

From 287 East:
- Take Exit 8W for Bloomingdale Rd/Westchester Mall Pl (mall entrance will be directly ahead of you at end of ramp)
- Turn RIGHT at light at end of ramp onto Bloomingdale Rd
- Make next RIGHT onto Westchester Ave
- Make next LEFT onto S. Kensico Ave, at corner of Mobil and BP gas stations
- Best Friends is ahead on your right, just past the first light.

From 287 West:
- Take Exit 8 for White Plains/Westchester Mall Pl
- Merge onto Westchester Ave, continue straight about 1/2 mile
- Turn RIGHT on S. Kensico Ave, at corner of Mobil and BP gas stations
- Best Friends is ahead on your right, just past the first light.

THANK YOU to Best Friends for letting us use their space for free!

If you have any questions or need help finding us, please call Nick's cell at[masked]<a></a>
results.name: Westchester Dachshund March McMeetup

results.description:
Second Sundays Brunch, Live Band, Art Demonstrations,Lecture and Dance Performance at Newark Museum.

FYI- I purchased my Brunch ticket click here to view brunch menu and purchase brunch tickets: http://www.newarkmuseum.org/second-sunday-mar13-2016

Brunch at the Newark Museum catered by David Ellis Events
Noon – 2 pm
Two pre fixe options are available
Full Second Sunday Brunch  $19.75
Continental Brunch  $9.75

Sunday, March 13, noon-5:00 pm

Join us every Second Sunday through June for lectures, performances, artist-led tours, art/science demonstrations and workshops, music and a special brunch menu catered by David Ellis Events. Programs are designed to showcase the Museum’s special exhibitions and permanent collections and enhance your gallery experience.


Musical entertainment provided by NJPAC Wells Fargo Jazz for Teens Ensemble. For brunch tickets please click here. 

To view menu please click here. 

Museum Explorer’s Women’s History Month Teen Tour
12:30 pm
Discover “girl power” and learn the stories of influential women as Museum Explorers highlight the work of female artists and important female figures in American history.

Artist Demonstration by Faraz Khan 12:30-1:30 pm and 2-3:30 pm  The word calligraphy comes from the Greek language meaning “beautiful writing”. Arabic calligraphy appears on both religious and secular objects and in every medium including architecture, paper, ceramics carpets glass, jewelry, woodcarving and metalwork. Join calligrapher and designer Faraz Khan as he demonstrates traditional and contemporary calligraphic techniques. Visitors are welcome to explore the creative possibilities and physicality of this ancient art form.   Gallery Tours: Women in Art as Muse and Maker 12:45 & 1:45pm Enjoy this Docent-led tour through the Newark Museum collections planned in honor of Women’s History Month.   Family Gallery Programs/Creative Play:  Drawing Patterns 1, 2, & 3 pm After touring Wondrous Worlds, visitors will create their own patterned drawing.   Newark Museum through the Eyes of Gallery Aferro Artists:  Patricia Dahlman 1:30 pm Current and past Gallery Aferro artists-in-residence provide a fresh perspective on the Museum’s collections and special exhibitions.  Patricia Dahlman, whose practice spans textile sculptures, stitched drawings, printmaking, and collaborative activities, highlights works of interest in the Museum’s collections.

http://www.newarkmuseum.org/sites/default/files/styles/large/public/galleryaferro_logo.jpg?itok=mJrsZ_LI Lecture: Sacred Samples, Secular Beats: Islam in the Hip Hop Imagination, 
2:30 pm
Zaheer Ali, Oral Historian at Brooklyn Historical Society and noted scholar on the life and work of Malcolm X will discuss the evolution and influence of Islam as an American tradition, as reflected through hip hop music and Black popular culture.

Performance:  Hip Hop Dance Performance by Jorge “PopMaster Fabel” Pabon 3:45-4:45 pm Hip hop legend and dance master Jorge “Pop Master Fabel” Pabon demonstrates the pioneering choreography that has revolutionized world-wide dance movements. A member of the legendary Rock Steady Crew and Universal Zulu Nation and an adjunct professor at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts, he has taught popping and locking as well as the history of dance forms associated with Hip Hop.  

Second Sundays presented by 

http://www.newarkmuseum.org/sites/default/files/styles/large/public/HBCBSNJ-%C2%AB_Foundation_ClosedGap_287c.jpg?itok=iYFXmk6z
results.name: Brunch,Live Band,Art Demonstrations,Lecture & Dance Performance @ Newark Museum

results.description:
Let's head to the Cookery in Dobbs Ferry on Sunday March 13th for lunch/Brunch as part of Hudson Valley Restaurant Week. I made a reservation for 10 people starting at 12 noon and we'll be seated at 12:30.  Your $3 will secure your spot. This is for HVRW - three plates plus dessert for $20.95 -- they are enabling us to pick anything from their menu. 

http://media.wix.com/ugd/ca759e_1b381208617f4d5090877975257ad4c4.pdf

The Cookery is a neighborhood restaurant dedicated to capturing the warmth of Italian comfort food while using sustainable products and keeping our prices modest.​ We cook for people who care deeply about what they eat but aren’t inclined to make a big fuss about it. Our Family is the source of our inspiration along with a passion for food, wine and fun.


Here are some comments by prior diners, "This place makes me so happy. The vibe, the music, the drinks, the staff, THE FOOD! I wish they took reservations for less than 6 people Bc we love to go but it's so busy we are never sure if there will be a table. Everything I've ever had has been cooked perfectly. I've always been satisfied. Oh, and stickabutta pie of course...don't leave without dessert. 

We want for brunch for the first time. Small plates, so filling and delicious.pork belly and biscuits and the egg in a jar were on point. And everything else we ate. Go to The Cookery. You will not be disappointed."

Another said, " Cauliflower is an awful, ridiculous, unneeded vegetable that tastes like crap ... and The Cookery's cauliflower ravioli might be the best thing on the menu. That's how good this place is.

In two visits, I've had eight appetizers and three entrees (that's not a typo, by the way) and each one somehow was better than the last; topped by the cauliflower ravioli, I have no idea how they made that terrible vegetable taste so good.

What I like most about the place, though, is how they manage to have one of the best restaurants in the area and it kinda-sorta looks like they aren't even trying. Many spots in the area have a shtick or a motif and that's fine. However, it is hilarious to see a restaurant put out such a great product as the Cookery does while totally not taking itself too seriously."

And one more said, "How does he do it? Chef Dave just keeps the hits coming, from innovative creations like the fried chickpea appetizer, amazing bitter greens salad and second-to-none pasta dishes. The Lamb Bolognese is as good as the first day I fell in love with it, as well as the cauliflower ravioli and butternut squash lasagne. Eyeball-rolling good! I just love this place. No need to schlep into the city for top-quality, delicious and sexy food anymore!"
results.how_to_find_us: Please find me in the bar
results.name: Let's go to the Cookery for Brunch/Lunch HVRW in Dobbs Ferry

group.name: Cheap Eats and other foodie delights of Westchester

venue.address_1: 247 Elizabeth Street  (South of Houston and West of bowery)
venue.name: T shop (Rear store behind the tarot card reader)

results.description:
Are you an energetic sponge? Do you soak up all that is around you, even if it's not your problem or worry?


Empathy is a wonderful tool for understanding and connecting with others, but too much enmeshment can lead you to feel drained, exhausted, irritable, sad or depressed.


Today we will learn how to:

Differentiate between our energy and others.


Protect ourselves from absorbing others' energy.


Cleanse ourselves of others' energy and feel ourselves again.

** Participants will purchase a cup of tea for our tea time, separately from the cafe. :) 


**I encourage everyone to leave a bit of extra time afterwards to connect with women in the group on a personal level to keep actively building community.

**Additional donations are welcome. These help maintain the high quality facilitation and consistency of programming.
results.how_to_find_us: It's a tiny cafe - you'll see us. My cell is 917-717-8275 if you need help. :)
results.name: Manhattan: Learn Energetic Boundaries

group.name: Women Living Brightly International: NYC + Brooklyn

results.description:
Guatemala Photography Workshop and Tour – March 2016

Join professional photographer Loren Fisher as he teams up with Edgar Monzón of Guatemala for a special eight-day photography workshop and tour in beautiful Guatemala. Edgar has lived in Guatemala his entire life and has produced an exceptional photographic coffee table book on the country’s friendly people and colorful places. Edgar is very proud of his country and is excited to welcome visitors and show the many faces of Guatemala.

Edgar has created a tour that focuses on three main concepts: color, culture and traditions. It aims to portray basic aspects of Guatemalan culture so you can appreciate it as an observer. You will create images of unique moments that involve people, traditions and history.

March 13-20, 2016
Early registration by Nov. 1 is $2,879. Regular Price: $3,479.
Rate is for double occupancy. Single supplement: $750.
Non-photographers: $400 discount.

We start in the city of Antigua, which is less than an hour drive from the main airport in Guatemala City. Our base in Antigua is the Casa Santo Domingo, a five star hotel that is a converted convent. If we didn’t leave the hotel grounds we’d make amazing pictures, but Edgar has us going to photograph colonial ruins, a volcano, convents and a colorful craft market. We will travel to other towns visiting Mayan communities, a coffee plantation, meeting people in their natural environment making crafts and clothes and we’ll be photographing unique ceremonies. We will take a boat to visit towns around a large lake, where the scenery is spectacular. (See the full itinerary below).

There are few countries left in the world where people live their historic culture, where they wear the traditional clothing of their ancestors on a daily basis and not just on special occasions. Guatemala is such a place. Guatemala is a living culture, full of people enjoying their colorful environment and traditions dating back to their Mayan ancestors and the colonial period.

As you are photographing beautiful Guatemala, Loren and Edgar will be working with you to ensure you get the best photographs of your life. We will offer tips on how to approach people, how to get candid photos, seeing and working with Guatemala’s unique light and strengthening your images with better composition. You will get instant feedback on your photography.

We will be out shooting early and staying out late to capture the best light of the day. We will take breaks for rest and dining during the day.

All of your Guatemalan arrangements will be made for you. We will meet you at the airport on Sunday and book your room in fine hotels. We will be traveling together in one van with Edgar at the wheel. He knows the areas we are visiting quite well and we’ll stop whenever a photo opportunity arises.

Being a tourist in Guatemala
You will need a valid passport but no special visa if you are staying less than 90 days. Electricity is 120V as in United States, so you don’t need special electrical adapters. All the hotels have Internet service and there is cellular phone coverage in the areas we are staying. The money exchange rate is very favorable for the tourist, right now it is 7.70 quetzales per dollar. There are areas of Guatemala that are not safe for tourists, mostly on the border with Mexico. We won’t be going anywhere near there. But like any other place, tourists can be targets, so you want to make sure you are careful and don’t flaunt your camera gear. See U.S. State Department page on Guatemala for more details. http://travel.state.gov/content/passports/english/country/guatemala.html

What is included:
Experienced Guatemalan guide
Lodging for seven nights (double occupancy)
Breakfast each morning
Ground transportation
Entrance fees
Professional photography instruction

What isn’t included:
Travel to Guatemala
Lunches and dinners
Alcoholic drinks
Gratuities
Non-meal time snacks and soft drinks

Who should Attend:
Anyone with an interest in people and culture – your photographic experience doesn’t matter. Most of our shooting locations will be in towns where some walking will be required. There won’t be long, strenuous hiking.

Rates
Rates are net, per person, in U.S. dollars, double occupancy.
Early registration by Nov. 1 is $2,879. Regular Price: $3,479. Single supplement: $750. Non-photographers: $400 discount. Registration fee includes breakfast, lodging (double occupancy) and ground transportation. It does not include airfare to Guatemala or lunches, dinners or gratuities.

Maximum group size: 8

The itinerary

Sunday, March 13, 2016
Arrive in Antigua Guatemala (estimated time from airport 45 minutes – 1 hour). Stay at Casa Santo Domingo, a 5 star hotel. It is considered unique because it previously was a convent (www.casasantodomingo.com.gt). The hotel itself is a photographic destiny. We will meet and have a get-to-know each other session, discuss photography and talk about our week in Guatemala.

Monday, March 14
Early breakfast.
Photograph local volcano, travel by golf cart through the trails.
Mid-morning – photograph ruins of convents and colonial churches: Capuchins, San Francisco and Cathedral.
Lunch in Antigua.
Afternoon – Visit crafts market. Objective: color and people
Overnight at Casa Santo Domingo Hotel

Tuesday, March 15
Early tour through the city. Objective: doors and windows of Antigua, colonial architecture.
Breakfast at a local restaurant.
In the morning: visit to a Mayan community. Objective: lifestyle, color, activities with local people.
Lunch at a coffee plantation: Finca Filadelfia.
Afternoon – photographic tour at the coffee plantation. http://www.filadelfiaresort.com/tours-en.html
Overnight at Casa Santo Domingo Hotel

Wednesday, March 16
The whole group travels to Atitlán together in a van, leaving very early in the morning for a 2.5 hour drive. We will arrive in Panajachel, Atitlán at 7:30 in the morning.
We will travel across the lake in boat, visiting some of the most interesting towns around the lake. We will visit the communities and handcrafts of the Mayan people. Objective: photograph people in their environment and their handcrafts.
Lunch in Santiago Atitlán, one of the towns around the lake.
Afternoon, we return in boat to Panajachel.
Dinner in Panajachel.
Overnight at Hotel Atitlán. It has an excellent view of the lake and breathtaking gardens. http://www.hotelatitlan.com/default-en.html

Thursday, March 17
Breakfast in Atitlán. Then we travel to Chichicastenango very early in the morning. Early in the day, we visit its colorful market, the vegetable market and the “Masquería” (a place where masks and ceremonial traditional clothes are made). Objective: photograph people and their colorful environment.
Lunch in a local restaurant.
Afternoon: Mayan religious ceremony. This ceremony is private and we are allowed to take pictures of the Xamán (Mayan priest) and his ritual in gratitude of the Earth and Mother Nature. Objective: photograph Mayan traditions, people and their religious ceremonies.
Night: Return to sleep in Atitlán (1.0 hour travel)

Friday, March 18
Breakfast in Atitlán at the hotel to see sunrise
Then a photographic tour walking through Calle Santander. This is a very colorful street market where Mayan people sell products.
Lunch in a small restaurant at the street
Afternoon we go to San Antonio Palopó, visiting the town and very traditional Mayan works (Telares)
Overnight in Atitlán

Saturday, March 19
After breakfast go back to Antigua Guatemala. Rest and enjoy the hotel.
After lunch we will meet to look at photos you have taken and you’ll get feedback.
Late afternoon sunset shoot.
Overnight at Casa Santo Domingo Hotel

Sunday, March 20
Sunrise shoot
Workshop ends, return to airport

Weather:
It's a little hot in March, about 80 degrees during the day and near 60 at night. You should have shorts, jeans and comfortable clothes, a hat or cap and some casual clothes for night. It’s very rare to have rain in March.

Dining:
Breakfast each day is included, it may be after a sunrise shoot. You are responsible for other dining expenses. We will be on the move but taking breaks to enjoy the scenery and dining.

Hotel:
Hotel accommodation costs are included. You may want to tip the friendly service.

Photo Equipment:
You’ll want to have a wide angle, telephoto and possibly a macro lens. Make sure you have lots of memory cards, spare batteries and charger and maybe a polarizer filter. I’m a tripod shooter, but we will be in lots of markets, churches and areas where a tripod may not be appropriate. But I’m bringing a travel tripod. I also suggest bringing a laptop to download your photos and a way to have a backup, either on the original cards or an external hard drive. If you aren’t absolutely sure of everything that your camera does, bring your instruction manual so I can help you fix any problems.

Payment: The full fee is required 120 days prior to the workshop.

Deposits and Cancellations:
A $750 deposit must be paid in order to secure your space in our workshop. Full payment must be received 120 days prior to the workshop.

I must receive notice of your cancellation in writing, at which time I offer the following refunds:
120 days or more before workshop: Full workshop or deposit refund.
119 to 60 days before workshop: 50% of workshop cost.
59 or fewer days before workshop: no refund. If you must forfeit your workshop fee we will refund your full payment, minus the deposit, if I can fill your spot. I will also issue you a credit to be used on another workshop within the next year.

No partial refunds are made for unused portions or services of a workshop. Workshops are sold as a package only.

If a workshop is cancelled, you will receive a full refund of any money paid, but I’d have to be on my deathbed before I’d cancel. But if I’m on my deathbed and need to cancel the workshop, I will not be held responsible for your other expenses, such as airline ticket, that may be associated with the canceled workshop. I suggest you purchase trip insurance to be safe, but I’ve never cancelled a destination workshop and it would take a major catastrophe before I cancel.

What else you need to know:
Once you register, you will receive a packet of information about the trip. It includes a Liability Release Form that needs to be immediately returned, an Emergency Contact and Medical Information Form, a detailed listing of our hotels with contact information, a history of Guatemala, details about some of the locations we will be visiting and more suggestions for equipment and clothing.

For more information and to register, go to http://lorenphotos.com/workshops/guatemala-photography-workshop-march-2016/

RSVPing on meetup does not get you registered for this event. There will be participants not in this meetup group.
results.name: Culture and Color of Guatemala

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.

WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...

1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated

9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved

Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.


WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>
results.name: Tennis Social (60 degrees)

results.description:
Updated March 5, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

________________________________________________________

THIS PERFORMANCE ENHANCING WEEKLY 1.25 HOUR CLASS IS NOT OFFERED ANYWHERE ELSE IN NYC! COME CHECK IT OUT!

By Cash or Check

Did I Already Mention----FIRST CLASS FOR ONLY $ 5!!

Bring a Friend Get a Free Future Class Pass!

Please dress in layers (cool to start) and it's okay to eat prior.  Please message any questions and pass this invite to your friends. Thank you and see ya you on the mat!


Namaste, Jennifer, RYT-500hr

results.description:
Enjoy a 1.9 mile, two-hour walk around downtown Princeton and the University campus as you learn about historic sites in the area, including Bainbridge House, Nassau Hall, the University Chapel and Palmer Square. The early history of Princeton, the founding of the University and the American Revolution are just some of the stories from Princeton’s history that you will hear on your tour.

Wear good walking shoes and dress for the weather. Rain date is April 3. 

The cost is $8, required when you RSVP. No paypal? No problem. Click here to learn how to use your debit/credit card without a paypal account. 

Space is limited so don't wait to reserve your spot!

We can have lunch before or coffee after if enough are interested.

As always, if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time.

results.description:
I was delighted to find a new book from one of my favorite authors!  An interesting twist with Jhumpa Lahiri writing in a foreign language (Italian) to find herself.  

Looking forward to exploring this with you.

Here's a link to the book on Amazon:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00XG9BT48?dpID=51bwt1CKYRL&dpSrc=sims&preST=_SL500_SR101%2C160_&refRID=B6G5ZGPFRNJS4M5NED64&ref_=pd_lutyp_simh_2_1

A blurb:

In Other Words is a revelation. It is at heart a love story—of a long and sometimes difficult courtship, and a passion that verges on obsession: that of a writer for another language. For Jhumpa Lahiri, that love was for Italian, which first captivated and capsized her during a trip to Florence after college. Although Lahiri studied Italian for many years afterward, true mastery always eluded her. 

Seeking full immersion, she decides to move to Rome with her family, for “a trial by fire, a sort of baptism” into a new language and world. There, she begins to read, and to write—initially in her journal—solely in Italian. In Other Words, an autobiographical work written in Italian, investigates the process of learning to express oneself in another language, and describes the journey of a writer seeking a new voice. 

Presented in a dual-language format, this is a wholly original book about exile, linguistic and otherwise, written with an intensity and clarity not seen since Vladimir Nabokov: a startling act of self-reflection and a provocative exploration of belonging and reinvention.
results.name: Discuss our recent read:  In Other Words by Jhumpa Lahiri

results.description:
We've got an extra hour of daylight, starting Sunday, and a springlike 60-degree day. So let's celebrate spring by staying outdoors rather than underground. (We'll save the subway art tour for a rainy day.) We'll tour most of the park, from south to north and east to west, ending at West 72nd st. 

If you no longer wish to attend, please change your RSVP online. And don't forget to move your clock forward one hour.

PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED.

DISTANCE: About 6 miles, though you don't have to do the whole walk, of course.

PACE: Moderate (about 3 blocks in four minutes), not slow. If you want to stroll rather than walk moderately, this is not the right event for you. 

LUNCH: Bring your own. We'll start eating in the park at around 2:30 PM. 


COST: $2, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee

ENDING TIME: Around 5:30 PM, but you can leave earlier, of course.

TRANSPORTATION: Consult tripplanner.mta.info (as well as a subway map, since the planner does not always find the best route). 

IF YOU CAN'T COME: No need to let me know. But please change your RSVP, so someone else can take your place, even  if it's just on the waiting list.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the small plaza (5th Ave. & E. 60th) at the southeast corner of the park. I'll be wearing a red cap
results.name: Spring forward in Central Park! (Subway tour postponed due to warm weather)

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 1-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
"Speak the truth, even if your voice shakes."

This is so important. As vegetarians/vegans, we are living in a world where the majority of people are either blind to the truth or simply ignore it. We know the truth, we have chosen to change our lifestyle because of what we know, and now it is our duty to speak up and educate others. If we are silent, we are not helping to advance the movement. Speaking up is not always easy, but nothing worth achieving ever comes easily!

We are going to have a day of both leafleting (see more about leafleting here and here) and writing chalk messages about veganism and animal rights on sidewalks/pathways (see the Vegan Chalk Challenge). We'll meet up at the Hoboken PATH station and start with a brief discussion during which experienced leafleters will give tips and answer questions. We will also discuss chalking and give examples of things to write/draw. Then, we will divide into three groups and spread out across Hoboken, targeting places like Church Square Park, Columbus Park, and Maxwell Place Park. Each group will have some members leaflet while others are writing the chalk messages. As people show an interest in what the "chalkers" are doing, the leafleters can hand out information and discuss our group and our purpose. We will also leaflet as we are walking to our destinations (probably down Washington Street as there is heavy foot traffic there).

The leafleting/chalking will last for 1.5-2 hours. Afterwards, we'll head to a local establishment to grab a bite to eat and socialize. We'll also discuss what we learned, what was positive, what was challenging, and how we can improve in the future. The whole event should be done in about 3 hours. Come for the whole thing, or pick which part you want to attend and just come for that part. If you are not sure you are ready to leaflet and/or chalk, please feel free to still join and just hang out with us and learn. Maybe you'll be ready the next time! It is our hope that we can raise awareness in Hoboken and hopefully meet new vegans/vegetarians in the process!

Note: While we welcome all veg types, this event is about promoting veganism, so please remember to advocate for veganism when chalking or and/or speaking to others, even if you are not vegan.

Let's get out there and be voices for animals!
results.name: Vegan Activism - Leafleting and Chalking

Dear Dharma Friends,

We will be holding a moving and sitting meditation followed by a Dharma talk on Zen in Everyday Life.

1:00 - 2:00 Sitting/moving meditation 

2:00 - 3:00 Lecture 

The lecture will be given by teacher Harry Miller.  Harry  studied  with  Master  Sheng  Yen  for  over  30  years.  He  was  editor  of  the  Chan  Newsletter  for  over  10  years,  is  a  frequent  contributor  to  Chan  Magazine,  and  a  lecturer  at  Chan  Meditation  Center (CMC).  He  is  a  board  member  of  Dharma  Drum  Retreat  Center  and  a  member  of  the  Dharma  Teachers  in  Training  at  CMC.  He  holds  a  B.A  in  French  and  English  literature  from  Sarah  Lawrence,  and  an  M.A.  in  Chinese  Literature  and  M.Phil.  in  Comparative  Literature  from  Columbia  University.

Look forward to seeing everyone,

_/|\_

Organizer

$30 in person/$33 via paypal - If you paid online PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
BEGORRAH! Sunday, March 13, 2016 - D&D Brunch @ Lovecraft NYC, the Cthulhuesque bar on the Lower East Side.

At the end of the rainbow sits a pot of gold topped with the BLOOD and SCREAMS of the BOLD and the GREEDY. For decades an insane fey creature has TERRORIZED the villages near the forest's edge, STEALING CHILDREN, animating plants to ATTACK innocent peasants and turning cows' MILK into LEAD. At last the local bishop's pleas for help have been answered by BRAVE ADVENTURERS sent by the KING himself to end this MENACE once and for all...

Face the All-Seeing Potato Golems (they're covered with eyes). Steal the Soul Gem of All Gingers. Avoid the unlucky Frost Charm Twins lurking near the Bog Of The Temperance Hag. Seduce the wistful banshee using a Gaelic rhyme. (Yes, this pre-St. Patrick's Day adventure is rampant with awful Irish cliches. Because reasons.)

Bring your own 5th level Dungeons & Dragons 5th edition character (bards and druids esp. welcome), or play one of the provide pre-gens. (As usual, this event is free but attendees are expected to purchase food and/or drink from the venue.)

Through an open, receptive, and steady approach she guides students to a place of inner balance, harmony, and union. She believes yoga can unlock inner creativity, healing, and a deepened sense of awareness. Find out more about Adriana at:

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
The Stilt-Sands are destroyed, and a terrible leviathan has awoken to plague the Ten Isles once more. All that remains of hundreds of sails and thousands of sailors are two ships and three hundred souls. Precipice Port is a fortnight away, the only destination for hundreds of miles of ocean, and you must reach it. Not all is as it seems amongst the sailors and refugees, however. Someone or something has slipped aboard, and its intentions are surely murderous. Can you reveal the hidden evil before it is too late?

Fortnight of Fear is the fourth chapter for the WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Sailing Against the Wind" by Noah Anderson. New and returning players are welcome. Characters are 7th level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.

Here are the details of the anti-Ringling demonstration:

WHERE: Ringling's 3 Ring Circus of Horror and Atrocity

The Prudential Center, 165 Mulberry Street, Newark, NJ, 07102 

WHEN: Sunday March 13, 2016

TIME: 2:00-4:00 pm

ASSEMBLY POINT: The corner of Edison & Mulberry Streets in the Ironbound Section of Newark, right outside the Prudential Center (see below map:)
MAP: http://www.mapquest.com/?version=1.0&hk=8-88kqUwFN

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: from NYC -Penn Station in NYC, one train stop to Newark Penn Station. Go outside and you will see the large Prudential Center sign on top of the building approx 1 block away.

DETAILS ON PARKING: There is parking on sidestreets everywhere in the vicinity of Mulberry & Lafayette Streets, and a number of municipal lots in the local area as well. Please think ahead and bring some quarters for metered parking, if you aren't lucky enough to find free parking (which is ample!)

Sunday March 13, 6-8 pm


Please help FAUN and our friends/allies stand up for animals enslaved by the heartless, horrific enterprise known as Ringling Bros Circus. Animals are enslaved, abused and forced to spend their dismal, horrendous lives engaging in behaviors wholly unnatural to them, performing under constant threat of pain and punishment by this ravenous cash machine of a "circus". and get treated like garbage even as those who survive all the horror, a joyless life of mechanistic use and abuse, approach convalescence.

Again, we will have signs, leaflets and relevant props. If you have something you want to bring, that's fine, but all you NEED to bring is YOURSELF, a heart full of empathy/compassion and a voice to demonstrate your love for pachyderms, primates, bears, big cats, all creatures great and small.

Blessed be ALL animals, FIGHT for their rights!!!

• Have an amazing time!

Every Sunday 3-5pm starting January 10th til April 17th, a week before the performance, 15 practice sessions.

Season Pass

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=2VLVLRLATSNKU


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 3pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( 

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

Let's jam those tunes!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. I will comment on some things (the architecture and social history of some of the buildings) along the way, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others. We will be stopping at  a number of points of interest. (IF YOU DON'T LIKE THIS STOPPING, THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU.) This walk is about 2 1/2 to 3 miles and moderate paced. 

I also have scheduled this same walk on Saturday, March 12th.

HAVE EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING. PLEASE DRESS PROPERLY FOR THE WINTER CONDITONS.

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photograph. 

Description: In celebration of Women's History Month, we will be discussing women architects, artists, designers, journalists, models, sculptors, and socialites from the late 19th century to the early 20th century. We'll talk about the battle for the top socialite of New York City; the "Tiffany Girls" rediscovered; the "sob sisters" sentimental appeal; architectural details with a feminine touch; the sculptress labeled the "poor little rich girl"; and female artist models whose face and figure we still see all around NYC.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer's Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time: The meeting time is (after lunch) at 2:00 PM.

Meeting Place: The meeting place is outside of the front entrance to the Time Warner Center, which is at 10 Columbus Circle at 59th Street and Broadway. Before the walk, restrooms are available on the south and north sides of the 2nd and 3rd floors at Time Warner Center. There will be limited places to stop for a restroom along the way.

Transportation Options: Take the A, B, C, D, or 1 subway train to 59th Street and Columbus Circle.

Finishing Time/Place: This walk will finish about 4:45 PM at the Upper East Side on East 66th Street between Park Avenue and Lexington Avenue. 

Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.


Below was Alva Vanderbilt, a prominent socialite, at her fancy-dress ball in 1883. She and her husband built an opulent French chateau-style mansion on Fifth Avenue, and the ball served as a housewarming party. She was married to William Kissam Vanderbilt, the grandson of transportation tycoon Cornelius Vanderbilt. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883]) 

(Photographer Jose Maria Mora was able to mingle easily with the upper classes of New York City and became the photographer of choice for the constant fancy-dress balls, tableaux, and other events of this era that required the upper class to get dressed up…which they did amazingly often.)

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

Below was Mrs. Seward Webb at Alva Vanderbilt's fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883])

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

Below was Miss Bessie Webb at Alva Vanderbilt's fancy-dress ball in 1883. (Source MCNY [Jose Maria Mora, 1883])

Below is from The New York Times, May 27, 1883

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

In 1895, Alva Vanderbilt divorced her husband William Kissam Vanderbilt because he cheated on her and then, a year later, married Oliver Hazard Perry Belmont. After Belmont died in 1908, she became an unlikely heroine of the women's rights movement and used her fortune to advance women's rights. 

Below was Alva Belmont, formerly Alva Vanderbilt, standing between Mrs. J.B. Batteli (left) and Elsie Hill at the dedication of the new headquarters of the National Woman's Party in Washington D.C. on May 1, 1922. (Source The New York Times)

Below is from The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, September 5, 1929.
results.name: History of Women during the Gilded Age and Beyond Walk (Mar 13)

group.name: NYC/NJ Walks: Explore Architecture, Art, History & Sculpture

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Once again, the Pugs and their Humans will be "infiltrating" Ridgewood, for a casual gathering at the Dog Park!


The Ridgewood Dog Run can be found at the Saddle River County Park Wild Duck Pond (you can find us in the small dog run). Please come and join us for some Puggie shenanigans and don't forget to bring doggie water and doo bags!

Note the dog run is now located around the pond and near the exit of the park (bordering Ridgewood Ave.). There is *some* available parking in a lot right before the run, so I might suggest you park there and then walk over (you can also park across the street, which could prove to be easier.) They haven't gotten around to install any seating in the dog run yet, so you might wish to bring a folding chair.

Please: ANYONE PLANNING TO ATTEND THIS MEETUP, IS REQUIRED TO RSVP. If anyone doesn't abide by this request and continues to appear at meetups without an RSVP, you will run the risk of being removed from the group. I do not wish to sound mean (and do not ask for much outside of this), but I need to keep track of attendance.

***Daylight Savings Time begins early Sunday morning, so don't forget to set your clocks and watches ahead one hour!***

I look forward to seeing everyone and their Pugs soon!

Ellen
results.name: Casual meetup at the Ridgewood Dog Run!

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

WHAT: Starting in Manhattan, join a whole buncha beautiful people as we walk across the Brooklyn Bridge followed by the Manhattan Bridge and finally the Williamsburg Bridge and finishing off the walk in Williamsburg. You can expect a day of amazing views, awesome photo opps, and babbling endlessly with new people. Check out the pics from a previous 3-Bridge walk we did. 

WHERE: We will meet on the parkside corner of Chambers and Broadway as seen here. While I do not recommend driving, you can use this address for your GPS: 277 Broadway, New York, NY 10007

WHEN: The walk will commence at exactly 2 PM so come 10 to 20 minutes early. If you are even 30 seconds late you will miss us and it's impossible to catch up.  

HOW TO FIND US: Look for the big group of people standing around talking to each other. If we're hard to spot, please do not hesitate to call the organizer Beau at [masked] and he will wave you over. 

PACE: The pace of the walk will be easy-going 

DURATION: Approximately 3 hours 

DISTANCE: 6.1 miles from point A to point B 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

Brooklynites and other New Yorkers! Come out to Ange Noir Cafe and play some Magic the Gathering, whether you are new to the game or an experienced player. And invite friends ... the more the merrier.

***The given time-slot can be shifted or extended to fit schedules or we want to play longer but please let me know a little in advance so we can schedule properly.*** 

*UPDATE REGARDING FINANCIAL INPUT: we have now gone to a yearly dues format, which if everyone in the group pays, we will have more than enough to cover the cost of being on Meetup. If not everyone pays, it may have to increase, but only slightly (right now at $2/yr.) The real purpose of why this group is here is to provide a non-financially demanding option for learning and playing/practicing the game.

results.description:
Be aware: There is no entry system at Mark's apartment, so go to the upper entrance, knock on the door or a window to the left of the door, and if no one answers, call[masked]-3368.

This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending. Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group. Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Friday, eleven days prior to the Meetup. On that day, I'll send out an email listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order, with a link to the Google Drive folder where the stories live. That list will also appear under Discussions and will be edited as changes occur.

To submit, Email your submission to [masked]

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam

MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.

Send to [masked]

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Brad's Novel Group

results.description:
It looks like a menu, but it's really a testament — our daily-printed promise to serve only the finest and freshest seafood. The Oceanaire has always been committed to using sustainably caught seafood. It is our goal to help our guests connect their individual buying decisions to the health of the oceans and the soil. Since our offerings are based entirely on market availability, we focus on simplicity, seasonal preparations and regionally inspired dishes. Ours is a menu that lives and breathes right along with our seafood.


Nothing brings out the wonderful flavor of fresh fish like the perfect wine. The tradition of pairing great wines with great food is brought to life at The Oceanaire. Our seasoned wine stewards will help you chart a course to the wine selection that best complements your meal.

Click on the link below to take a look at the brunch menu

Please remember to pay the 2.00 member dues to RSVP

http://www.theoceanaire.com/Home.aspx
results.how_to_find_us: Oceanaire Seafood Room

results.description:
Organ Donation and Assisted Suicide are two topics that are very relevant for today. Co-lead by rabbis Susan Elkodsi and Jill Hackell, we will explore and discuss texts from the Torah, Talmud and later rabbinic literature, including 19th and 20th century sources, that address these issues.

Free and open to the public, but please RSVP so we have enough nosh.
results.how_to_find_us: We are in the downstairs of the Bridge Church Building, enter through the parking lot on Hempstead Ave.
results.name: Learn and Talk about Jewish Perspectives on Organ Donation and Assisted Suicide

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP RESPONSIBLY.  IT TAKES FOREVER TO GET A RESERVATION AT THIS PLACE, SO YOU ARE GOING TO HAVE TO RECONFIRM THAT YOU WILL DEFINITELY, ABSOLUTELY, WITHOUT A DOUBT BE GOING WHEN WE GET CLOSER TO THE EVENT IF THERE ARE PEOPLE ON THE WAITING LIST.   IF YOU'VE HAD A "NO SHOW", YOU WILL NOT BE ALLOWED TO RSVP FOR THIS EVENT.  AND, LIKE ANY EVENT, YOU MUST HAVE A PHOTO OF YOURSELF ON YOUR PROFILE IN ORDER TO RSVP.

THIS IS A "CASH ONLY" EVENT.  IF YOU DON'T BRING CASH, YOU WILL NEED TO FIND AN ATM TO GET SOME.  WE WILL USE THE "x1.3" WAY TO FIGURE OUT THE BILL. CHECK OUT THE GROUP TIPPING POLICY HERE.

Yes, I said BOTTOMLESS BRUNCH!!  

Calle Ocho serves unlimited sangria when you purchase a brunch entree. Prices range from $19 to $33 (that serves 2 people) for entrees. Check out the menu, and get ready for a fantastic, and what will be sure to be a FUN (with not only a capital F, but a capital UN as well!) brunch!  The free sangria is served while we are still eating, so we don't need to rush through the meal (although they do have a 3 hour time limit).  


The reservation time is for 2:15 p.m.  Please arrive by 2 pm at the latest.  

Here are their brunch "rules"

BRUNCH HOUSE RULES 

• Please enjoy one glass of sangria at a time. Don’t worry, there is plenty more where that came from!

• Complimentary sangria is served during the course of your meal, not forever (unfortunately)! If that last bite of burrito has been sitting on your plate for 3 hours, you’re kind of toeing the line of “forever."

• If one person gets cut off, so does the rest of your table. So please ask your boyfriend to save his awesome tabletop dancing skills for another day.

• Management reserves the right to discontinue serving any patron at any time. (Boring, we know -- our lawyers made us put this one in).

• Sangria is served in 20 oz. glasses, so don’t be sad if you don’t get to all the flavors. We still think you’re a champ!

• No sangria is allowed outside the restaurant.

• Please don’t forget your children here. We WILL put them to work.

• We encourage our guests to enjoy a fun, leisurely sangria brunch, but please also be mindful of our additional reservations. Your fellow brunchers would also like to enjoy the sangria (and perhaps a bite to eat).

• Please drink responsibly.

HAVE FUN AND ENJOY!

This event will be for My New Friend members only.  No guests.  So if you have someone that you want to come, they will need to sign up for the group and RSVP for themselves.
results.how_to_find_us: An email will be sent out before the meetup to those attending.
results.name: BOTTOMLESS BRUNCH!!!

results.description:
"These are wonderful, unique workshops. You will be amazed at how much healing and joy you receive during a class. Join us! If this is your first class, please join us as our gift to you. You can find more info at LifeChangingHealingCenter.com." Love, Sondra

"It was truly the most powerful healing I have ever been blessed to be a part of." - attendee

If you are looking for a change for the better, or just want an extra boost on your spiritual journey, please join us in these enlightening workshops. You won't be surprised by what you learn in these workshops, you will be TRANSFORMED! In these transformational workshops, you will be brought through a process which will bring you more happiness and love than you can imagine right now. You will enter a powerful healing vortex that will support you and help you release what you no longer need to carry. Through spiritual teachings, channeled meditations and inspirational music, you will enjoy powerful personal journeys while challenging old belief systems that may have kept you stuck in limiting and unhealthy patterns. Take the first step. We are here.

"This Sunday session was like food to the soul. You sat back, enjoyed the good music and spirit took over. What a wonderful way to enjoy a Sunday afternoon, relaxing around like-minded energetic people under the direction of a truly inspirational teacher, Sondra. Thank you for your time, guidance and direction."


"Your class helped me release so much pent up stuff that I didn't even realize was there, I feel like I took this huge baggage off of my back, thank you thank you thank you!"

"I am so honored and feel so blessed you are offering this workshop, it is unlike any other being offered on the planet right now...."

"My life will never be the same."

"The work that we're doing in your classes is just so incredibly powerful. Thank you so much. I love you so much."

"I am still amazed by the magnificence of the evening yesterday. With love and deep appreciation to you."

"Thank you for a wonderful healing yesterday. Sondra, you are a wonderful example of love and it transfers onto all the people you come in contact with. Love,love,love. "

"It was an honor and a privilege to attend your workshop. I wanted to attend your workshop because I know you have such a beautiful and strong connection to God and it is felt by everyone. Thank you."
results.how_to_find_us: second floor
results.name: MORE TRUTH WILL SET YOU FREE healing and transformational class

results.description:
Get tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

(No tickets will be sold at venue. You must PrePay online - This event almost always  sells out by the event day so get your tickets now. It's unlikely tickets will still be available by the day of the event)

When: Sunday, March 13th 2016: 2:45 to 5:00 PM
Where: House of Brews (2nd Floor) - 302 W 51st St, New York, NY 10019

So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few more cocktails. You'll get to mingle and make some new friends and also get to enter into a fun raffle for a chance to win a prize!

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

BY THE WAY... YOU DON'T HAVE TO HAVE ANY ARTISTIC ABILITY TO ENJOY THIS EVENT. FOR MANY PEOPLE ATTENDING IT WILL BE THEIR FIRST TIME PAINTING ANYTHING IN YEARS. THE ARTIST WILL WALK YOU THROUGH EVERYTHING STEP BY STEP.

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great time meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

WE RECOMMEND GETTING YOUR TICKET AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AS WE HAVE LIMITED SPACES AVAILABLE FOR THIS EVENT AND MANY TIMES IT SELLS OUT.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html
