group.name: The Best NYC Singles Parties & Social Events

results.description:
Wanna play, sing, jam, try out new tunes, showcase unique take on covers, or just dig some fabulous local performers, live music, drink specials? This must be the place...Heartbreakers Open Mic, every Sunday, 3-7pm, Music ONLY, no backing tracks, at McLouglin's Bar, 31-06 Broadway, Astoria, NY, next to Broadway N train subway stop.....Originals or covers or short jams... 2-3 song sets with recycling........ Bring your guitar/ bass/ drum/ ukelele/ harmonica/ tambourine/ instrument of choice/ looper/ and any cords you may need, or just bring yourself, it is a fun open and diverse crowd. We provide PA, 2 mics, one straight mic stand, one boom mic stand (hopefully drum kit in the future...)  No drink minimum, tho it will be polite to the house have a soda or drink, there are drink specials during the events starting at $5 drafts/$3 PBR cans.....AND check out group page on Facebook.com/groups/heartbreakersopenmic.....FREE... Host: Wendi G, Mistress of Music
.........................................................................
“Walk tall, kick ass, learn to speak Arabic, love music and never forget you come from a long line of truth seekers, lovers and warriors.” ― Hunter S. Thompson
results.how_to_find_us: N train to Broadway stop in Astoria
results.name: Singers Songwriters Musicians & Live Music Luvrs Open Mic

group.name: Astoria Heartbreakers Open Mic Singer Songwriter Musician

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 3.00pm and finishes at 3.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

results.description:
Hello PlaySoccer2Give supporters,

As you all know we have NYCFC in town and we love their heart for giving back to the community. Learn more about how NYCFC is involving themselves in the local community here: http://www.nycfc.com/community

Please join us and other PS2G'ers at the NYCFC game against Toronto FC and celebrate this awesome sport with a fun match at Yankee Stadium.

We have a limited number of discounted tickets in a great section together and part of the proceeds will go to our charity network. 

If your full name is not in your meetup name please leave it in the comments section when buying tickets. (we pre-pack and label envelopes with tickets, we also need it if you are late and we need to drop the envelope @ will call)


This is a big group and the logistics are a lot for PS2G to organize we respectfully plead, beg, request… did we mention beg?… that you are early or on time (3:45-4pm) so we can make sure everyone in the group gets their tickets and gets in the stadium with as little hassles as possible. It does take some time to get through security so we want to be in the stadium and be able to have time to grab food/drinks before the game starts. You being late also means one of use needs to take more time to go to the will call office to drop tickets etc etc. So please be on time so we can all relax and have a great time. 

Please see the itinerary for the day so you can all plan your day out accordingly. Also, below is some info on transportation and some stadium guidelines for security to follow. Please read all and make sure you and you party joining us understand everything. Feel free to contact Chris W @ [masked] or[masked] with any concerns or questions if you are not getting answers in the comments section of the event but note that phone signals are not great inside the stadium so please contact me BEFORE we enter (4:25-4:30pm) the stadium.

The following is the day’s Itinerary :

before the meetup time ~2pm - some of us will be @ Bill’s Sport Bar [856 River Ave, Bronx, NY 104 (718)[masked], see picture #1 below] - If you would like to come early we will be here with some of the local NYCFC supporters groups, including “The Third Rail”, “Brown Bag SC”, "Bronx Football SC” and “NYC 12”. Enjoy some time with fellow NYCFC supporters before the game.

3:45-4pm - We meet across the street from Bill’s Sports Bar by Heritage Field (see Picture #2) We will have our Logo Banner to help you find us (see Picture #3) - Here we will meet up with our whole PlaySoccer2Give Group to do roll calls  and pass out tickets. Once we pass out tickets we can head into the stadium and get through security in time to grab a bite/drink and get to our seats before kickoff at 5pm. Please note: It is important to plan ahead to be here on time so we do not delay the whole group. Security lines will be long for this. 

Subways: the 4, B, or D trains all let off right by both Bill’s and our meeting location

The following is quoted from emails sent to me from NYCFC staff about Festivities, Rules and Transportation….. Please read all…  they are not every rule so if it’s not covered below and you have a question please ask.


1) Subway/Train: 


4, B and D trains all go near the Stadium but the 4 Train (161st St Stop) is the closest to the Stadium, Billy's Sports Bar and the pre game meeting location.

Metro North:Click the following link for some very useful Metro North Train info as it relates to the matches http://web.mta.info/mnr/html/mls/nycfc_mls.htm

2) No-no-no’s:·


Please do not bring your laptop otherwise you’d be turned away! No exceptions·

Any type of bag bigger than 16x6x8 will be turned away. No exceptions·

Security is going to be top level so please have patience, plan ahead, and understand it’s for our own safety

PICTURE #1 - BILL’S SPORT BAR LOCATION



Picture #2 - Meeting for roll call and ticket distribution on sidewalk by Heritage Field (see grey arrow on north side of the field) -Find us with our Banners here. Notice we will be down the sidewalk a little from the corner so we all have room for all 40+ of us to meet up safely




Picture #3 - the PlaySoccer2Give Banner to look for out our meeting location looks like this:

Picture #4 - Virtual View of our group seat location. Section 215

(Virtual Seat View from our group section: this is shown to approximate the view. )





#PS2G
#NYCFC
#LOCALGAMEGLOBALCHANGE

Use Social Media hashtags #PS2G and #NYCFC with your pics/posts please.

Welcome back Fun Gamers!

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games".  

[[ NOTE -- 

Why not bring someone new this week & introduce them to our little family of friendly gamers?...  ;-)

-- NOTE ]]

Come & have some fun!!!

I look forward to seeing you all there!...

FYI for the new meeples, we're averaging a solid 20 ppl per week now (just not everyone RSVPs...)  Speaking of RSVPs, I know MeetUp has a cut-off for RSVPing if you decide to show late so please don't let that hold you back...  I'd love for you to all RSVP, but it's definitely not a requirement (the only requirement is to come and have fun!)

Which Panera?... How to find us?...
FAQ - Location, Location, Location... (or at least Panera Bread's Location ;-)


• http://www.meetup.com/Fun-And-Games-Meetup-Tenafly-Northern-New-Jersey-NJ/messages/boards/thread/48006932

Please help us grow!...  please share our group on Google+ & Facebook!

There are "high-res" photos available if you want to print a flyer for work and/or school!

Thanks,

George

a.k.a. Jorge Loco

PS RSVP isn't required, but it'll definitely help me out!

PPS Shall we play a game?

Jesus Hernandez Bojaira Band Performs at Flamenco Latino!

Jesus Hernandez Bojaira Band Concert at Flamenco Latino!
Sunday, March 13, 2016 at 4:30pm
at Flamenco Latino Studio Theater
244 W. 54th Street, Suite 404, 4th floor
between B'way/8th Aves, NYC!

Jesus Hernandez is a phenomenal proponent of Flamenco Jazz Piano in town for the 2016 Flamenco Festival. His concert at Flamenco Latino will be a special concert of music plus discussion of concepts. This format is not being presented at other venues. Performing with Jesus are: Mark Holen, percussion, Alfonso Cid, cante, Tim Ferguson, bass, and possibly Surprise Special Guest, dancer Maria de los Angeles

Prices:
In Advance: $17
Day Of Concert: $20
Discounts: $10 Seniors, $5 Children
Credit/Debit Cards accepted
Call[masked] or go to Ticket URL listed above for prepayment via PayPal

Additional Events:
Friday March 18, Joe's Pub, 9:30pm

Flamenco/Jazz Master Class at Flamenco Latino
Saturday, March 19, 2:00-4:00pm

The Performance and Master Class events at Flamenco Latino are made possible, in part, with public funds from the NYC Dept. of Cultural Affairs, in partnerhsip with the City Council.

results.description:
So the workshops at Adorama were intended to discuss essentials of taking long exposures and trying to capture movement. But if you're like me, it takes some hands on experience to really get to learn something. So I present to you . . . . . Part II of the Long Exposure Workshop!

After part one of the workshop, there's ample time to clear your schedule, check to see what gear you have and what gear you need, look up some of the photography terms online and get yourself ready to put all that knowledge to use. We will meet at the corner of Delancey Street and Pitt Street in Manhattan, close to the Williamsburg Bridge. Once there, we will walk over to the East River Promenade and get out gear ready for a view of the sky, East River, Williamsburg Bridge and the people walking along the promenade. Here, you can make clouds stretch across the sky, make water turn smooth as silk, get light trails from the cars on the bridge and make people on the promenade disappear. (Don't you wish you could really do that with a camera???) 

We'll get there BEFORE sunset so we can look around the area, set up shots and capture the sunset over the bridge. Then, we can get some really long exposures when the sunlight is completely gone. This is when you can get into the rhythm of setting up your camera for long exposures. I will wait until the morning of the 13th to see if the weather forecast calls for rain. If the chances of rain are over 40%, I will reschedule the MeetUp. Hope to see you all there!

• Night photography and long exposures are always better with tripods, however we will be located in a place with pedestrian traffic.  If you have a strong, table-top tripod or gorilla pod, those would be handy.  

• Don't forget your charged batteries and empty memory cards. If you have any lens filters, those may also come in handy.

• As always, please be on time. Allow yourself enough travel time and check the MTA for any subway updates. 

• Details of this event may be added or changed at any time, so please check in periodically on this page.

********************


Disclaimer: Participation in these events requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities, and that the Organizers, Co-Organizers and Event Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more details, please review our rules and disclaimers.


Meetup requires a semi-annual fee to organize and maintain the group's event page.  If you would like to send a contribution to help keep NYC Photographers up and running, you can send $2.00 or more via PayPal at [masked].  This is NOT a requirement, but any amount will be greatly appreciated. Thank you!
results.name: Long Exposure MeetUp Part II: Outdoor Long Exposures

results.description:
Solo Travel is an art form. It’s a way of leaving everything behind and discovering another part of yourself. Michael Jason Sherman, MA, is an Imago Relationship Therapist and the author of THE ZEN OF SOLO TRAVEL: A JOURNEY
FROM ANXIETY TO ENLIGHTENMENT, a book that takes you on a breathless, life-changing trip to Japan.
! Since 2012, Michael has been sending clients on transformational solo travel journeys. Whether they leave for a few hours drive or
fly to the other side of the globe, these “solo travelers” all come back having experienced an unforgettable personal awakening.
! Come be a part of this fascinating, interactive workshop and book talk. Michael will lead healing exercises while reading some
insightful passages from the book, all to inspire you to discover your own “solo travel journey.”
! NEOLYTH HEALING CENTER - 39 Glen Ridge Ave, Montclair, NJ
Sunday, March 13th, 2015 - 4:30-6:30pm - $10 per person (suggested donation)
! “It’s hard for me to put into words what it’s like to take a Solo Travel Journey with Michael Jason Sherman’s guidance and teaching.
It’s like flying.” - Virginia P., Program Graduate and Licensed Marriage Therapist
Learn more at www.SoloTravelTransformation.com
results.name: Solo Travel Transformation

results.description:
All you love is gone. The Stilt-Sands, a floating city you have called home since birth, was torn to pieces before your eyes. Ensorcelled before the disaster, you could do nothing to save anyone but yourself, watching the horror as if it were nothing but a bad dream.

Your refuge is the Salty Cormorant, an odd amalgamation of pirate and Navy vessel. There, you came fully back to your senses, and are filled with nothing but rage and pain. And you aren’t the only one. You, and the other 300 survivors, have been robbed of home and health, and there are others who would see it righted, or avenged. You are told that you sail for Precipice Port. A fortnight cannot pass soon enough. Until then, you will find out everything the crew of this strange ship knows, to find some clue about the terrible beast He. However, you are not alone in this pursuit. The evil that trapped your minds has followed you, and it is not done with you yet. 

Stilt-Sand Survivors is the first chapter in the new WildPig Exclusive Campaign "Vengeance at Sea" by Noah Anderson, set in the “Ten Isles” setting developed by Noah Anderson in association with the WildPig community. All players are welcome. Characters are 1st level, with a limit of 8 players per session. There will be time for character creation a half-hour before the first session. Seats are limited, so please register ahead of time.
results.name: D&D 5E: Vengeance at Sea Chapter 1 - Stilt-Sand Survivors

Here are the details of the anti-Ringling demonstration:

WHERE: Ringling's 3 Ring Circus of Horror and Atrocity

The Prudential Center, 165 Mulberry Street, Newark, NJ, 07102 

WHEN: Sunday March 13, 2016

TIME: 6:00 - 8:00 pm

ASSEMBLY POINT: The corner of Edison & Mulberry Streets in the Ironbound Section of Newark, right outside the Prudential Center (see below map:)
MAP: http://www.mapquest.com/?version=1.0&hk=8-88kqUwFN

PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION: from NYC -Penn Station in NYC, one train stop to Newark Penn Station. Go outside and you will see the large Prudential Center sign on top of the building approx 1 block away.

DETAILS ON PARKING: There is parking on sidestreets everywhere in the vicinity of Mulberry & Lafayette Streets, and a number of municipal lots in the local area as well. Please think ahead and bring some quarters for metered parking, if you aren't lucky enough to find free parking (which is ample!)

Please help FAUN and our friends/allies stand up for animals enslaved by the heartless, horrific enterprise known as Ringling Bros Circus. Animals are enslaved, abused and forced to spend their dismal, horrendous lives engaging in behaviors wholly unnatural to them, performing under constant threat of pain and punishment by this ravenous cash machine of a "circus". and get treated like garbage even as those who survive all the horror, a joyless life of mechanistic use and abuse, approach convalescence.

Again, we will have signs, leaflets and relevant props. If you have something you want to bring, that's fine, but all you NEED to bring is YOURSELF, a heart full of empathy/compassion and a voice to demonstrate your love for pachyderms, primates, bears, big cats, all creatures great and small.

Blessed be ALL animals, FIGHT for their rights!!!
results.name: **"FAUN vs. Ringling: Animal Circus, Begone!" demo @ Prudential in Newark, NJ!**

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join other NYC Singles for an early evening wine social happy hour event at sexy new Upper East Side Wine Bar Vella.

Event runs from 5-7:30pm

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PREPAY ONLY - $25

http://winevella.eventbrite.com

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

SEE VENUE:

http://vellanyc.com/

INCLUDED:

• One glass of red or white wine from the selections chosen by the bar

• Staff of greeters and a host to welcome you and help make introductions to other guests

• Light appetizers including fresh cheese and meat platters and flat bread.

• A wine themed ice breaker to encourage mingling

• Prizes

• Additional $7 select red or white wine drink specials until 7:30pm


Vella is giving our members a semi-private area of their bar to mingle.

Singles of all ages are welcome but the designated age range for this event is 30's-50's singles.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.
results.name: Wine Social for 30's-50's Singles at Sexy Vella Wine Bar

results.description:
Let's get together and talk about poly, our poly lives, support each other in dealing with poly issues, and above all, have fun. We meet between 5:00 and 7:00 If enough folks are interested, we can continue the discussion after the meeting over dinner at a nearby restaurant. Potluck snacks are welcome. We ask a donation of $5 to help cover room rental costs, but no one is turned away because they can't afford it. We want you there more than we want the money.

Note that this meetup is announced here and in several other places, and people sometimes come without signing up, so the signup list bears little resemblance to the actual attendance. All poly, poly curious, and poly friendly people are welcome regardless of sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, race, or any of the other things some groups use to discriminate.
results.how_to_find_us: We meet on the 2nd Floor in Room #2
results.name: Second Sunday Discussion Group

group.name: The New York / New Jersey Polyamory Meetup Group

results.description:
Join us for a fun rooftop mixer (don't worry it's heated) at the beautiful Hotel Chantelle!  

When you arrive, you will be greeted by a FREE drink and given a raffle ticket for a chance to win some cool prizes! Then feel free to mix, mingle and make new connections!

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (Must purchase tix in advance here) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/rooftopmixer/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_0500PM

$10 for first 10 members (price increases to $15 after that)

What to expect:

•  FREE drink upon entry

•  FREE Raffle

•  DJ & Dancing 

•  Prizes & Giveaways (courtesy of Seeco)

•  Up to 100 Meetup members 

No tickets sold at door. Must purchase ticket in advance here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/rooftopmixer/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_0500PM

FAQ: 

Is this event private? It will be 100% private. Members can invite guests to join us. 

Is there a dress code or age/ethnic specific? No hats, sweats, t-shirts etc. Jeans ok. Dress stylish. 

Is it age/ethnic specific? No. All are welcome 21 and older.  

Can I come alone? Yes, most come on their own. Come alone or bring a friend - either way you'll feel comfortable and have a great time.

Who will be the event host? Our host will be Javier. Feel free to ask for him when you arrive.  

Why does your RSVP say +50? This is a multi-Meetup event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We expect up to 100 members to attend. 

Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/rooftopmixer/dates/Mar-13-2016_at_0500PM
results.how_to_find_us: Heated rooftop
results.name: Sunday Funday Rooftop Mixer (Free Drink, DJ, Raffle, Prizes & More!) PREPAY ONLY

group.name: Greater NYC and Long Island Over 40 and Ready For Fun

results.description:
Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.
results.name: Sunday Walk Around Bayonne and Rutkowski Parks

Ciao a tutti! 

My name is Filomena and I am an Italian native speaker and suggest we meet at a coffee shop to help you to practice and improve your Italian! 

The conversation groups have three levels (beginner, intermediate, advanced) and last for 1 hour. 

There is a maximum of 7 students per group and costs $10/person if there are more than 3 people or $15/person if they are 1-3 people. 

Please don´t sign up if you are not absolutely sure that you can come. My phone number is[masked] just in case you can't find me. 

A prestissimo!

Hi all!

It was freezing, and it was Valentine's Day, but thanks to all who came to discuss The Color Purple by Alice Walker this past Sunday.  A bunch of us carried on and had a couple drinks in a very nice and quiet back room at Prohibition, too.

Next, we will be reading and discussing The Line of Beauty by Alan Hollinghurst, which is available at Book Culture's various locations.  (I would still call ahead to make sure they have copies on hand.) We will meet on March 13th at 5pm.


After our discussion we will also be having drinks at Prohibition, located nearby at 503 Columbus Ave, between 84th and 85th. If you can't snag a RSVP, or just want to kick on, feel free to join us for drinks/food.

We will be having a vote - to be organized shortly - to choose our next title for April.  Please email us with any recommendations at [masked]. 

Jessie + Tanmoy

results.description:
Day's will get a lot longer on Sunday, and sunset is going to be at 7:01 p.m. Let's take advantage of it with an evening stroll in the Mid-Hudson region!

I'm going to be recovering from Burroughs Range in the Catskills on Saturday, but I want to try and get a second hike in for the weekend. Beacon fits the bill. I'll probably be taking this slower than my usual pace, due to leg mush syndrome. So it'll be a good opportunity for people that haven't been able to brave the "cold" and want to start to get back into shape for the summer. This will also be a good chance for people that haven't ever tried a night hike, and want to.

If weather is warm and dry, we'll probably hang out on summit for a while. So, bring food, and drinks.

 


Required Gear: Headlamp, 1 liter of water, backpack, rain jacket, food, adult beverages, I like hiking poles for this trip.

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding look out point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson river and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip

The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain.
Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit.

+++

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

Don't be late , we start on time : )

results.description:
Let's go to Harvest on Hudson as part of Hudson Valley Restaurant Week on Sunday March 13th starting at 6pm. I made a reservation for ten people - -we will meet in the bar and be seated at 6:30 and your $3 will confirm your spot. As part of HVRW, we will enjoy a 3 course meal at this five star restaurant for $29.95 plus tax, tip and drinks. 

 Overlooking the Hudson River and the Palisades, Havest's Tuscan Farmhouse is one of the most beautiful restaurants in the New York Area. Garden and patio dining, sunset views, a comfortable lounge and a 30-foot high stone fireplace make the Harvest a perfect choice for any event.

The Mediterranean cuisine prepared by Chef Vincent Barcelona is centered on Italy and includes foods and flavors from throughout the region. Their garden provides dozens of varieties of Heirloom tomatoes, peppers, eggplants, and other vegetables and herbs—all of which find their way into Vincent's cooking.

I will post the menu when it is published but for now you can check out their website to view the regular menu: http://www.harvesthudson.com/

Here are comments from prior diners: 


"Harvest serves Italian food with general Mediterranean influences - their menu categories are pretty basic, but some standouts are a variety of artisan pizzas and pastas - plus a selection of cured meats and cheeses and a raw bar. On my most recent trip I decided to start with the crispy artichoke - it was flavorful and the leaves were fried nicely. It came with shaved parmesan and a lemon wedge which complimented the flavor of the artichoke well. For my main I had the shrimp bruschetta which was out of this world - large shrimp served with white beans and cherry tomatoes in a lemon butter sauce served on top of a grilled country bread. The flavors were amazing, and they didn't skimp on the shrimp which I appreciated. For dessert I had the peanut butter ice cream cake - you can taste the peanut butter without it being overbearing, it was the perfect finisher. 

I know other reviews cite the service as a weak spot but I've never had a bad experience with it. Harvest is probably my favorite Westchester restaurant on the river and one I will return to time and again."


Another said, "My fiancée and I came here for Valentine's Day and not only is the food amazing, but 5 stars for the ambiance and service. They had a 3-course meal. I ordered the Caesar salad and wow was it amazing. And for entree, I got the chicken scarpariello and it was delicious. My fiancée got the short rib and it was melting in our mouths! Definitely make sure you come here and you won't be disappointed."

And one more reported,"This is a beautiful restaurant on some prime real-estate! Went for restaurant week dinner sunday evening and it was a pretty dusk light that filled the interior. Started w a drink at the bar. Bartenders were helpful, knowledgable and accommodating. Had the mule, it was delicious!
Sat by the window for dinner, pretty views and calming atmosphere. Apps were the Cesar salad for my bf, carpaccio for me. The carpaccio was very delicious paired w the zucchini and cheese it comes w. Entrees were short rib and pork milenesse. Short ribs were better than the pork by far! Desserts were the chocolate and the grape desserts. Both were delicious and a nice ending. Drinks were strong, service was good , place was beautiful!
results.how_to_find_us: Find me in the Bar...
results.name: Let's do Hudson Valley Restaurant Week at Harvest on Hudson!

results.description:
Photo Credit: Jazzville, NJ member, Maurice Jefferson

Robin's Nest in Linden is truly one of the friendliest venues we've ever been to. Walk in once and you're part of the family.

Plus, it doesn't hurt that the open jam session lets everyone join in the fun. Musicians and vocalists are invited to get on stage and join the band for a few songs.

Over the years, we've had members grace us with their talents and it's always fun to see someone you know join the band for a few numbers.

There is no cover and the food is excellent, so bring an appetite!

Your GPS is not misleading you

Robin's Nest is in a very residential area. Most first-timers think their GPS is taking them the wrong way. Just continue to follow it. Once you get to the club, it's very visible amongst all the houses.

A Note About Parking

It's a small lot and double parking is common. If you are on a time schedule, it's best to park on the street so you don't get blocked in.

The area around the club is very safe and there is plenty of space on the surrounding streets.

How To Find Us

Robin's Nest is a cozy little place, so you shouldn't have any trouble locating us, but if this is your first time joining the group, you might not recognize us right away.

Here are three easy ways to find us:

• look for the Jazzville, NJ Meetup sign: http://bit.ly/zBZxVL

• look for me: http://bit.ly/zP11QP

• ask at the bar for the "Jazzville, NJ Meetup" group

Don't be shy! Come introduce yourself and partake in the music and merryment!

peace and jazz,

D.A.
results.why: Robin's Nest is the place to be on Sunday evenings! If you're a singer or musician, you can join the band on stage. If you're not, just get ready to be blown away by the talent!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the door or the bar for the Jazzville Meetup group or look for the Meetup sign.
results.name: Second Sundays: Cool Jazz Open Jam @ Robin's Nest, Linden

results.description:
Join us on Sunday March 13th, for another great night of Cinema Italiano!

                           at 6:30pm we will show: 

                     --- Romanzo di una Strage --- 
               in Original Italian with English Subtitles

    a great movie about a tragic piece of Italian history 

                       Trailer: CinemaItalianoNY.com
                               --->Tickets Here <---

Marco Tullio Giordana (The Best of Youth) delivers a Machiavellian drama, based on a book by Paolo Cucchiarelli, which dissects the Piazza Fontana bombing, highlighting the manipulations and tragic consequences of the event and subsequent investigations. An explosion at the Banca Nazionale dell'Agricoltura in Milan in 1969 resulted in 17 deaths and injured dozens more. The protests sweeping Europe and the fear of communism led the police to focus their investigations on anarchist groups.

Cast:

Valerio Mastandrea: Luigi Calabresi 
Pierfrancesco Favino: Giuseppe Pinelli 
Fabrizio Gifuni: Aldo Moro 
Laura Chiatti: Gemma Calabresi 
Stefano Scandaletti: Pietro Valpreda

Directed By: Marco Tullio Giordana
results.how_to_find_us: St Patrick's Youth Center - 268 Mulberry Between Prince & Houston
results.name: Piazza Fontana: The Italian Conspiracy, 2012 - by Marco Tullio Giordana

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
1. In the opening pages of The Rent Collector, Sang Ly’s grandfather promises that it will be a very lucky day. What role do you think luck plays in our lives? How does the idea of luck reconcile with the novel’s epigraph, the quote from Buddha on the opening page?

 2. After reading Sarann (the Cambodian Cinderella), Sopeap and Sang Ly discuss how story plots repeat, reinforcing the same lessons. Sopeap calls resurfacing plots “perplexing” and then asks, “Is our DNA to blame for this inherent desire to hope? Is it simply another survival mechanism? Is that why we love Sarann or Cinderella? Or is there more to it?” How would you answer? What are possible explanations for the phenomenon?

 3. Sang Ly says that living at the dump is a life where “the hope of tomorrow is traded to satisfy the hunger of today.” How might this statement also apply to those with modern homes, late-model cars, plentiful food, and general material abundance? 

4. Sang Ly mentions that Lucky Fat has an “uncanny knack of finding money lost amongst the garbage.” Do you suppose someone may have been helping him by placing money for him to find? If so, who?

 5. Speaking of her clock, Sang Ly says, “Sometimes broken things deserve to be repaired.” What might she be referring to more than the clock? 

6. The shelters at Stung Meanchey are built to protect the resting pickers from the sun. What other purposes do they serve? What “shelters” do we build in our own lives? How would you react if the “shelters” in your life were constantly being torn down? 

7. At first, Ki is reluctant to welcome change, specifically to see Sang Ly learn to read. He says, “I know that we don’t have a lot here, but at least we know where we stand.” What do you think he means? When have you found it hard to accept change?

 8. Sopeap tells Sang Ly: “To understand literature, you read it with your head, but you interpret it with your heart. The two are forced to work together—and, quite frankly, they often don’t get along.” Do you agree? Can you think of examples?

 9. Koah Kchol, or scraping, is an ancient remedy Sang Ly says has been practiced in her family for generations. Do you have your own family remedies that have been passed down? What are they, and do they work?

 10. Sang Ly and Sopeap discuss dreams. Have you ever had a dream that changed your attitude, decisions, or outlook? Was it a subconscious occurrence or something more? 

11. In a moment of reflection, Sang Ly admits that she doesn’t mean to be a skeptic, to lack hope, or to harbor fear. However, she notes that experience has been her diligent teacher. She asks, “Grandfather, where is the balance between humbly accepting our life’s trials and pleading toward heaven for help, begging for a better tomorrow?” How would you answer her question?

 12. Sang Ly speaks often to her deceased grandfather, but not to her father, until after her meeting with the Healer. Why did her attitude change? How might the same principle apply to relationships in our own lives? 

13. Sopeap always wears thick brown socks, no matter the weather. As Sopeap lies dying, Sang Ly notices that the socks have slipped, exposing scars on Sopeap’s ankles. How would you presume Sopeap got these scars? How might Sopeap’s scars (or rather their source) have influenced her appreciation for the story of the rising Phoenix? In what ways does Sopeap rise from her own ashes, literally and figuratively?

 14. The story ends with Sang Ly retelling the myth of Vadavamukha and the coming of Sopeap to Stung Meanchey. By the time you reached the final version in the book’s closing pages, had you remembered the original version in the book’s opening pages? How had the myth changed? How had Sopeap changed? How had Sang Ly changed?

 15. When the story closes, Sang Ly and her family are still living at Stung Meanchey. Are you satisfied with the ending, that they remain at the dump? Why or why not?
results.name: Discussion of The Rent Collector by Camron Wright

results.description:
Another Brain Awareness Week event, organized by Pint of Science, focused on the biology behind our senses. Last Pint of Science event was interesting and very lively (astronomy + solid waste disposal + beer.. how can you go wrong?).

This event is FREE, but be sure to RVSP, and arrive early. Event starts 7:30, but good to arrive at 7.

Details and registration HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/pint-of-science-presents-the-art-of-perception-tickets-19235857969
. . . . .
At this Pint of Science event we will dive into the biology behind our senses, from the organs that sense external cues to the neurons that integrate sensory signals. Jim Hudspeth (Rockefeller University) will take us into the inner ear to explain how hundreds of thousands of tiny hairs allow us to hear a diverse range of sounds. Paula Croxson (Mt. Sinai) will discuss how memory helps the brain interpret, and sometimes misinterpret, the signals it receives from the outside world. Want to know how quickly your senses adapt? There will be live science demos that let you play with your brain (curious what that means!).
results.name: Pint of Science presents: The Art of Perception

As you probably know, Dove Men+Care have been showcasing their #RealStrength campaign (Care makes a man stronger) since their NFL Playoffs highlight reels featuring Carson Palmer and Jordy Nelson and are now bringing it to March Madness.    


Here’s how the pool works. 

First, RSVP “YES” to this meetup to officially let us know that you'll be participating in the City Dads Group bracket pool.

Next, Complete your bracket. Note: You will have to wait until this Sunday, March 13 for Selection Sunday for the 64 teams to populate into the system.  To get into the bracket group and make your picks, click this link: http://games.espn.go.com/tournament-challenge-bracket/2016/en/group?groupID=658220

The password for the group is cdgbrackets 

If you don’t have an account with ESPN, you’ll need to create one, its free, quick, and easy. Again, the tournament pairings will be announced Sunday, March 13 during "Selection Sunday", and from there you can start making your picks. You’ll need to be finished with your picks before the Round of 64 starts on Thursday, March 17th at 11amEST. If you are having any trouble, message Jeff Tepper - jeff at dallasdadsgroup.com -  and he’ll help out.

**We’re also planning an exciting Dads Night Out slated for Friday, March 18th to watch the first round of the tournament together, so stay tuned for that meetup announcement (you will have to RSVP for that separate event) and plan to come out!**

results.description:
Astral travel has been described as a feeling of separating from the physical body and being able to see yourself and the world separate from your own body. Some may call this an Outer Body Experience (OBE). Some quantum physicists have tried to explain this phenomena away by saying this is experience is merely a hallucination triggered by some neurological mechanism. But we live in a time now when more people are having the same experience.

Join us on March 8, 2016 from 7pm-9pm EST when we will explain astral traveling and share some techniques that will enable you to experience this for yourself.

Some of the topics that will be covered are:

-What is astral traveling?

-Is it the same as an OBE?

-What is sleep paralysis?

-How to astral travel with a purpose.

...and MUCH more! This will be a LIVE 2-hour event. Make sure you don't miss this one and spread the word!

https://youtu.be/FqpFoljsPgU

https://youtu.be/eVgaxZj6RF0

***Be sure to include your email address when you purchase a ticket.  The access link will be sent to the address you provide.

results.description:
Our March book is 1963: The Reivers by William Faulkner

The Reivers, published in 1962, is the last novel by the American author William Faulkner. The bestselling novel was awarded the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1963. Faulkner previously won this award for his book A Fable, making him one of only three authors to be awarded it more than once. Unlike many of his earlier works, it is a straightforward narration and eschews the complicated literary techniques of his more well known works. It is a picaresque novel, and as such may seem uncharacteristically lighthearted given its subject matter. For these reasons, The Reivers is often ignored by Faulkner scholars or dismissed as a lesser work. He previously had referred to writing a "Golden Book of Yoknapatawpha County" with which he would finish his literary career. It is likely that The Reivers was meant to be this "Golden Book". The Reivers was adapted into a1969 film directed by Mark Rydell and starring Steve McQueen as Boon Hogganbeck.


As always, we'd love to have you join us, even if you haven't read the whole thing, if you've never come before, or you haven't been here in months. We don't care. We're not one of those clique-y groups. Come on by and pull up a chair.

Come join us on Sunday, March 13th!

Happy reading, 
-Joe

P.S. #1: Oh, about the $1 fee: Meetup charges $15+/month to maintain a Meetup group, so this is just an attempt to defray that cost. 

P.S.#2: If you do need to cancel for some reason, please do so with as much advance notice as possible. We’ve now have more than 400 members and we may well have a waiting list for our events. By canceling as soon as you can, you enable others to participate as well, which is nice for all.
results.name: 1963: The Reivers by William Faulkner

I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

Pete Lee (HBO), Esther Ku (MTV), Sean Donnelly, Seaton Smith, Dante Nero, Jon Laster and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

results.description:
Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Childhood toys

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

Please consider sharing your project photos with our other chapters on our Facebook group.

Join Certified Psychic Medium and Health Coach, Sarah Milligan, for a 30 day Mind/Body/Soul Wellness Group! It will be an inspirational (online) space for people to transform their lives.


We will focus on nutrition, exercise and mind/body awareness, and will incorporate healing meditations, psychic guidance, and a toolbox of personal development to help you reach your specific goals.

You'll also get coaching, an online support group, a nutrition plan, an exercise plan for YOUR body, and a nutrient dense super food shake to use as one quick and easy meal or snack each day. 

And this is not just about losing a few pounds (although you will), it's about designing the life you want. It's about committing to your emotional, spiritual and physical health. We honor the whole body!

EVERYTHING above is $140-$160 (depending on your program). What do you have to lose besides old patterns and limiting beliefs?? 

To discuss your goals and the best program to follow during this group transformation, please email Sarah at [masked] or RSVP and leave your email in the comments. 

Sign-up must be completed by March 5th to get your package in time to start on the 14th!

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
The New York City Economic Development Corporation (NYC EDC) and B Lab have launched the Best for NYC program to celebrate and support businesses that positively influence their workers, their community, and the environment. Participants are asked to take the "challenge" and fill out a brief survey about their business practices. Those who participate will be recognized by the city in an online and print directory, and will have access to special events and other benefits. 

THIS IS THE LAST WORKSHOP BEFORE THE DEADLINE FOR BEST FOR NYC WRAPS UP ON MARCH 15 - DON'T MISS THE CHANCE TO BE A PART OF THIS MOVEMENT!

In this workshop, the EDC will present details about the program and guide participants through the process of filling out the challenge. By the end of this workshop, we hope that everyone attending will be signed up and eligible for the program. 

Goodnik has partnered with the Impact Hub NYC , the Centre for Social Innovation, Be Social Change, and Civic Hall to host these workshops because because we support and promote socially responsible business practices and want to encourage all our members to do business in a better way. You don't need to attend the workshop to take the challenge - take it on your own today!

TAKE THE BEST FOR NYC CHALLENGE


Special benefits for Goodnik members who take the challenge;

• A "service grant" of 100 goodnikels, to be used for 10 hours of professional services at Goodnik.net.

• Free tickets to Be Social Change events and 20% off BSC classes through March 15, 2016

• One week of free coworking at the Centre for Social Innovation or Impact Hub NYC for non-members

• Exclusive events and parties 

• Inclusion in ‘Best for NYC’ Guide (print & digital), reaching 150,000+

• Exclusive events and services

• The opportunity to be featured in citywide awards and press*

• Membership in a vibrant networking community

• Ability to use ‘Best for NYC’ participant logo

• Tools to benchmark performance and create improvement plans

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.
results.name: Monday Meetings at Morton's (The Steakhouse)

group.name: Smart Transition Group - Business Networking that Works

results.description:
Adventures with Agile are excited & proud to announce a meetup with Dr. Jeff Sutherland.

Join Dr. Jeff Sutherland, the co-creator of Scrum and CEO of Scrum Inc.  as he discusses: 

How to make your teams faster, the competitive secrets behind high-performing organizations and how to create value that wins using the Power of Disruptive Leadership.

To attend this meetup please register here. 


When: 
March 14, 2016 
Doors open 5pm. 

Program begins 6pm followed by Q&A and Pizza. 


Seating is limited, please register today to secure your seat!


About Dr Jeff Sutherland: 

Jeff is the co-creator of Scrum and a leading expert on how the framework has evolved to meet the needs of today’s business. The methodology he developed in 1993 and formalized in 1995 with Ken Schwaber has since been adopted by the vast majority of software development companies around the world. But Jeff realized that the benefits of Scrum are not limited to software and product development. He has adapted this successful strategy for several other industries including: finance, healthcare, higher education and telecom.

As the CEO of Scrum Inc. and the Senior Advisor and Agile Coach to OpenView Venture Partners, Jeff sets the vision for success with Scrum. He continues to share best practices with organizations around the globe and has written extensively on Scrum rules and methods. With a deep understanding of business process — gleaned from years as CTO/CEO of eleven different software companies — Jeff is able to describe the high level organizational benefits of Scrum and what it takes to create hyperproductive teams.

Where: 
BNY Mellon
225 Liberty Street
New York, 
NY 10010

Ticket cost: $5 + small booking fee. Register here.

Thank you to  Mike Goldverg from BNY Mellon & Scruminc for making this event possible.
results.name: How to make your teams faster - with Dr Jeff Sutherland & Scrum Inc

results.description:
On Monday, March 14, 2016 at 5PM Huge will host its second annual 𝜋 Day Hackathon.

We’ve invited high school students studying computer science to join a team of software professionals for 3 hours and 14 minutes to create anything that has to do with 𝜋 (or pie).

This year we encourage any students to take lead on an idea and get mentored to see the execution come through.

Prizes are TBA, but they’ll be just as awesome as last year.

So what exactly do you do for a 𝜋 Hackathon? 

You to tell us. 

There's only one rule:  make it 𝜋-related. 

Here are the rational rules behind everyone's favorite irrational number:

• You will have 3 hours and 14 minutes to code.

• Regarding what you make, the only rule is that your code must have something to do with 𝜋 (the vernacular 𝜋, so code doing something with a pie is another option).

• You will have 3 minutes and 14 seconds to do your presentation (𝜋 minutes)

• Hack groups can be no larger than 5 but we encourage about 𝜋.

What does it mean to make a 𝜋-related application?  

Here are some ideas if you can't think of one:

• An algorithm that calculates the digits of 𝜋 to a certain amount of places in 10 different programming languages

• A recipe book application for cooking pies

• A drawing application that utilizes 𝜋

• A music application that features a song about 𝜋

• An education application that helps children understand geometry with 𝜋

This is meant to be fun and not intense and crazy. Since you have only 3 and 14 minutes to make this right, we're looking for creativity and completeness of the application.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wM-x3pUcdeo
results.how_to_find_us: Elevator to the 3rd Floor. (~𝜋)
results.name: 𝜋 Day Hackathon

results.description:
Please note that you can alternatively sign up for this event at eventbrite:  bit.ly/1WcxkPE

Itinerary:

5:30pm: Reception in Julia's Lounge


6pm:  Technical Sessions


Scott Locklin, Kerf - High performance columnar databases with an integrated programming language for solving large time series problems

Hugh Edmundson, Theorem - Data science for market place lending


Matthew Dixon, Quiota - Machine Learning for algorithmic trading


7:00pm: Discussion and Networking*


Abstracts: 


Kerf is a high performance columnar database with integrated programming language for solving large time series problems. It is written in C and supports native JSON and SQL. Kerf can be used for trading platforms, feedhandlers, low-latency networking, high-volume analysis of realtime and historical data and logfile processing.

Theorem is an investment manager in the marketplace lending space. Our team uses machine learning and data science to identify loans with the highest risk-adjusted return in the $100 billion marketplace lending space. We use these insights to manage capital, advise investors and create stable portfolios across the business cycle. Theorem is backed by Two Sigma Investments, Y Combiantor, Max Levchin and other leading investors. Theorem has raised and is deploying over $150 million in capital.


Quiota is a consulting and information-as-a-service start-up specializing in providing machine learning and financial modeling services for trading, investment management and compliance. We are building a team of data scientists and quants with a background in machine learning and financial econometrics to enhance trading and portfolio management workflow.


About the Speakers: 

Scott Locklin is a former Lawrence Berkeley National Labs physicist. He has worked on  operations research, machine learning, forecasting and quantitative finance problems since 2004.


Hugh Edmundson is the CEO and Co-Founder of Theorem. Before Theorem, Hugh was a member of Morgan Stanley’s Credit Derivatives team, where he structured and traded synthetic CDOs. He holds a BS in Computational Finance from Carnegie Mellon University.


Matthew Dixon is an Intel funded tenure-track Assistant Professor of Finance and Statistics at the Illinois Institute of Technology, Chicago, and CEO of Quiota, LLC.  He has worked for investment banks as a quant and held academic appointments at Stanford, UC Davis and USF. He holds a PhD in Applied Math from Imperial College, London. He is also the co-founder of the Thalesians.


About the Thalesians: The Thalesians are a think tank of dedicated professionals with an interest in quantitative finance, economics, mathematics, physics and computer science, not necessarily in that order. Learn more about us at www.thalesians.com.


* Please note that we will head to a nearby restaurant for dinner and drinks afterwards. Please email [masked] if you are interested in joining us so that I can estimate the head-count.

results.description:
"To practice Zen means to realize one’s existence moment after moment, rather than letting life unravel in regret of the past or daydreaming of the future.

To “rest in the present” is a state of magical simplicity, although attainment of this state is not as simple as it sounds. At the very least, sitting Zen practice, called zazen, will bring about a strong sense of well-being, as the clutter of ideas & emotions falls away and body & mind return to natural harmony with all creation.  Out of this emptiness can come a true insight into the nature of existence, which is no different from one’s Buddha nature." —Peter Mattheissen

A weekly Meditation Group in the Zen Tradition.

Open to All!

Every Monday

5:30 — Beginning Instruction
(If You are new to Meditation/Zen style or want a refresher, please arrive a few minutes early)

6:00 — Zazen/Seated Meditation (*)

6:25 — Walking Meditation (*)

6:35 — Zazen/Seated Meditation (*)

7:00 — Talk / Discussion (*)

(*) — Possible to join the evening at any time.

Donations accepted

Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

results.description:
**Come any time between 6:00pm and 9:00pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. You will pay for only the food you order (plus tax and tip). **

Join us as spring is about to begin at the delicious Kailash Parbat! It is famous for their street food from India! Kailash Parbat, named after a sacred Himalayan mountain, was started over 60 years ago in the Sindhi tradition and opened its first restaurant in Mumbai, India. Now people from all over India along with those from Singapore and London enjoy their food. Now we can too!

New York Daily News says: “there’s the delicious, nuanced, affordable Punjabi vegetarian food.” But you get more, you get the culture as well. The Daily News continues: ”…the cultural chasm hits you almost immediately upon entering this latest branch of a 60-year-old worldwide chain…A sense of amiable chaos permeates every meal”

New York Daily News praises:  “Pav Bhaji…described as a ‘favourite Indian street food,’ is fashioned from mashed potatoes and vegetables .. .an unexpectedly tasty dead ringer for a good ol’ sloppy joe. This transformation of meat-free ingredients is pure alchemy...” and “Bhugal Bhee Aloo,…a toothier concoction of steamed potato and lotus root in an earthy, cumin-infused tomato masala, deliciously demonstrates how, in able hands, similar ingredients can yield vastly different results.”

Kailash Parbat is known for its chaat found in India, Pakistan, Nepal, and Bengladesh. Per Women Around Town (womanaroundtown.com): “…chaat, known as pami puri, which was a refreshing bowl of yogurt served with lentil dumplings, mint and tamarin chutneys, and sprinkled with sev and cilantro. … was texturally exciting…and in-house biryani, a traditional rice dish served with carrots, peas, and cottage cheese, accompanied by three different sauces…tastes more delicious than it sounds or looks…Overall, Kailash Parbat serves exquisite northwest Indian food from Mumbai, not typically found in New York City.”

Citimenus.com compliments: “Much as I love Indian food, desserts have never been my favorite part of the meal but the kulfi, a denser, creamier version of ice cream, sprinkled with chopped pistachios, is a good finale…Overall, the food is terrific and reasonably priced. The modest setting with paper place mats and napkins, wooden floors and Indian graphics on one wall is very appropriate as this is an entirely unpretentious spot that emphasizes good eating in a relaxed atmosphere.”

For those of you who have never attended one of our Meetup events: this is an incredibly friendly & welcoming group. It will be easy to find our group: we are taking over the majority of the restaurant. Also, everyone pays for their own meal. Easy!

A note for our vegan members: Please ask the staff to clarify between the vegetarian and vegan dishes.

Where to Meet: Most of the people in the restaurant will be us. You can ask any member of the waitstaff where the "meetup" is. They will direct you to our tables.

Train Directions: Take the 6, N, or R Trains to 28th Street. Or you can take the B, D, F, M or Q Trains to 34th Street (and 6th Ave.) and walk a bit.

**Come any time between 6:00pm and 9:00pm, stay as long as you want, or leave when you need to. You will pay for only the food you order (plus tax and tip).**

Join us for a delicious dinner at Kailash Parbat on Monday, March 14th.

Eddie

You're Invited to Savvy Ladies Achieving Goals & Networking Event. 

It's free to attend, but you must register, here: http://j.mp/1TAau6Z . Don't miss this inspirational and informative evening. Save your seat now for "If your Wallet were a Fitness Tracker, would you be Achieving your Goals?"

Join us and our panel of industry experts who’ll be covering the unique challenges young professionals face, including: 

~~ Balancing tough financial choices

~~ Optimizing your student loan obligations

~~ Avoiding the debt trap: Ensuring that your personal finances are on course

~~ Achieving your career goals: Essential skills for getting ahead in your career

Moderator:

Mandi Woodruff, Personal Finance Correspondent, Yahoo Finance

Panelists:

Nikki Singh, Director of Campus Relations, CommonBond

Lois Barth, Human Development Expert, Motivational Speaker and Coach

Carrie Pink, Financial Lifestyle Blogger

The event is free to attend courtesy of Savvy Ladies, but you must register, here to save your seat: http://j.mp/1TAau6Z

Savvy Ladies Inc. is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization that brings financial planning education to women:

Through its unique programming, the organization has helped over 10,000 women across the spectrum of ages, life experience, and income levels identify their goals, make proactive choices about their finances, and lead richer, more rewarding lives. 

Savvy Ladies instills the importance of financial planning and provides women with the resources to make informed financial decisions for themselves and their families. 

Savvy Ladies’ education is about more than teaching participants to balance their checkbooks, it’s about making families stronger, communities better and ultimately changing society.

I hope to see you on Monday, March 14th at this very special learning and networking event! 

All best wishes, Zorka

results.description:
We will power up the Major Welch, take in the sunset & socialize briefly at Perkins Tower, then descend on the AT.

We will meet in the main parking lot. If you are running late, you are welcome to catch up with the group if we have begun.

This is not a beginner hike. You should have some hiking experience and be getting regular exercise. While it is only four miles, there is significant elevation gain on the Major Welch.

Make sure you have a copy of the map, a headlamp, and minimum 2 liter of water. If you fall behind during the hike, you must be prepared to finish on your own. Faster hikers are not obligated to wait for slower hikers. Typically we meet at the parking lot and begin together. As we ascend, the group breaks off. We will do our best to reconvene at the peak and begin our descent together. The amount of time we spend at Perkins will depend upon the weather. You must feel comfortable hiking out on your own should you fall behind. We would love to have everyone join but due the nature of an evening event we can not make accommodations for those who are unable to hike independently. There is no sweep. If you are unsure whether or not this is for you, please email me with any questions.

Heavy rain cancels and would be determined that day if necessary.

Distance: about 4 miles

Gain: about 1200

Hike time: 2 - 3 hours

HUDSON VALLEY HIKER LEGAL DISCLAIMER & WAIVER OF LIABILITY

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant

Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader - This is YOUR hike

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members!

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-)
The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

In these years we have organized hundreds of social events, French lessons and workshops, French concert etc...

results.description:
Mark Howe Murphy
(March 14, 1932 – October 22, 2015)
Memorial Concert Celebration:
Monday, March 14, 2016
Reception at 6:00 pm; Concert at 7:00 pm
at the Sanctuary at
St. Peter’s Church, New York City
619 Lexington Avenue at 54th Street
New York, NY 10022
[masked]
www.saintpeters.org

The life, career and legacy of the late Mark Murphy, whom the Washington Post described as “a daringly original jazz singer whose unchained improvisational style made him a cult favorite and a powerful influence on a generation of younger performers,” will be celebrated with music and reminiscences on Monday, March 14, 2016 at St Peter’s Church in Manhattan.

Performers and speakers scheduled to appear include Itamar Borochov, Michael Bourne, Alan Broadbent, Daniel Čačija, Jay Clayton, Richie Cole, Roz Corral, Carol Fredette, Kurt Elling, Spiros Exaras, Will Friedwald, Giacomo Gates, James Gavin, The Hanky Panky Trio (Alex Minasian, Brandi Disterheft, Steve Williams), Sheila Jordan, Nancy Kelly, Kate Murphy, Mark Edmund Murphy, Francesco Pini, Annie Ross, The Royal Bopsters (London, Meader, Pramuk, and Ross), Sean Smith, Tessa Souter, Ronny Whyte plus special guests.

Murphy, who passed away October 22, 2015, was a six-time Grammy nominee who enjoyed a prolific 40-year recording career, with over forty releases in his name. His original lyrics to 'Stolen Moments,' 'Red Clay' and more are known the world over. His innovative projects range from the work of Nat 'King' Cole to Jack Kerouac to Ivan Lins and Eddie Jefferson. Stereo Review dubbed Mark 'one of the major artists of our age.' 'For decades the question 'What exactly is a jazz singer' 'has had two easy answers, Betty Carter and Mark Murphy.' wrote the New York Post. 'He was arguably the best male jazz singer in the business,' declared Rex Reed.

The event is co-produced by Ari Silverstein, a New York impresario and founder of NYCJazzTour.com, and Jean-Pierre Leduc, founder of Lunched Management & Booking, and Murphy’s last manager. “We wanted to make Mark’s first birthday since his passing a memorable one, an evening worthy of the man himself,” said co-producer Silverstein. “There is a distinct line between those considered artists and those who are considered innovators. Mark was the latter, pushing boundaries and the standards for the sub-genres of jazz, for example his inclusion of poetry, book readings, highly original scat solos or his own lyrics. Everything Mark touched he truly made his own.”

Leduc observed that, “while Mark was underappreciated by the music business at large, and the general public too, for that matter, every astute singer idolized this giant, and was regularly amazed by his artistry on recordings and his magnetism and charisma on stage. In his later years, this gift was undiminished, as countless dazzled audiences will attest.” Leduc added that he expects the event to be cathartic, too, as it will be “the first opportunity to collectively and publicly grieve Mark’s passing.”

Living legend and jazz vocalist Sheila Jordan adds, “Mark Murphy was like a kid brother to me. I loved his caring, his sense of humor and his wonderful singing. His music will live forever.” Wendy Oxenhorn, director of the Jazz Foundation of America, was also a dear friend, saying "Mark Murphy is and will always be on a planet of his own. 
Unreachable. Few flew as high. His ballads were untouchable. Mark was a bird alone, like Abbey, Chet and Jimmy Scott.” Oxenhorn adds, “Mark was one of the greatest abstract expressionist vocalists that ever roamed the earth. This Celebration of Life will give us the chance to send him off with our gratitude for the freedom, the grace, the love and the space he gave us to fly with him.”

The producers acknowledge the invaluable assistance of The Jazz Foundation Of America.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Practical information about the event:
Memorial Concert Celebrating the Life and Music of Mark Howe Murphy March 14, 2016.
Reception at 6:00 pm; Concert at 7:00 pm

The Sanctuary at St. Peter’s Church, 619 Lexington Avenue (Entrance on E 54th St.) Admission is free; space is limited; seating is first come, first serve.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Photographs of Mark Murphy, as well as interviews with Mr Silverstein, with Mr Leduc or Ms Oxenhorn, are available upon request. Please contact [masked] or [masked].

Mark Murphy’s NY Times obituary: http://nyti.ms/20E3cTD
Mark Murphy’s Washington Post obituary: http://wapo.st/1QEC4JP
Mark Murphy in conversation with WBGO’s Michael Bourne: http://bit.ly/qwRRE7
Mark Murphy performing on Marian McPartland’s “Piano Jazz”: http://bit.ly/1MQBLPX
