results.description:
What is happening in 2016?  What trends are coming to fruition right now?  What trends are just starting that will make a big impact down the road?  In this talk, we bring together three technologists from different industries who will discuss which technology excites them, where they think we are headed.  We’ll look at what is blowing up, and what will take a little bit longer to get going.  Our panelists are in Medical Imaging, Virtual Reality and Educational Media. 

Livestream:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qpNYKt7d2jY

Panelists:  

Caitlin Burns is the COO of Datavized, an immersive design and technology studio specializing in WebVR and data visualization. She currently serves as Vice Chair of the Producers’ Guild of America’s New Media Council and East Coast Co-Chair of the PGA Women’s’ Impact Network.

For 10 years, Ms. Burns worked as a Transmedia Producer and Franchise Strategist for media companies dealing with emerging business models and multiplatform coordination. Past clients include Pirates of the Caribbean, Disney Fairies, Disney Descendants and Tron Legacy for Disney, James Cameron’s Avatar for Fox, Halo for Microsoft, Happiness Factory for The Coca-Cola Company, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles for Nickelodeon and Transformers for Hasbro. She has also worked with Showtime, Pepperidge Farm, Diageo, The Canadian Media Fund, The Oregon Health Authority, Tribeca New Media Fund, UNICEF, FEMSA, Wieden+Kennedy, Reebok, Stratasys and the US Government.

Lou Auguste was born in Queens, NY. A recovering film maker, Lou has been developing mobile apps since 2012. His company AlexaPath is based in Brooklyn, NY. Together with co-founder Dhaval Palsana, Auguste has developed a technique called mobile Whole Slide Imaging or mWSI. mWSI is smart phone medical slide imaging. Their solution is part hardware and part software, allowing the user to turn any standard light microscope into a powerful digital imaging device. AlexaPath is currently working with the Association of Haitian Physicians Abroad (AMHE) to create screening programs for cervical cancer in Haiti. Check out their indiegogo campaign to learn more.

Michael Watson is a freelance editor and social media strategist. Currently working for The History Channel, his past work includes writing and editing for the educational Youtube Network, Vsauce, and running logistics for the social media campaign for the 2013 Oscar nominated documentary, "The Square."

Moderated by: 

Erek Tinker is the Director of Business Development for The Spry Group and has been moderating the Future of Series for Pax Solaria. He is interested in the technical, business and cultural implications of new technologies. He loves bringing together diverse views on interesting topics to stimulate engaging conversations.

Come visit Flatiron School's campus for a Pi Day Happy Hour! If you have questions about learning to code online, this is a perfect opportunity to come and chat with us. 

We'll have some drinks and--of course--some pie. Feel free to embrace the spirit of Pi Day and bring a pie to share as well. :-D

If you'd like to check out the free Intro to Ruby Development curriculum you can get started now, but this will be a primarily social event where you can meet with others learning to code, find out more about what it's like to learn to code online, and eat some pie. 

Can't wait to see you then!

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Note: We will start at 6:35 exactly.  

Description:  Any engineering leader charged with delivering software needs to understand the techniques that improve delivery velocity.  Many of these are very context dependent - what speeds up a 5 person team, can slow down a 100 person organization.

In this interactive workshop we will examine what techniques and processes improve or retard velocity, and your role as a leader in shaping these.   We will examine technical, process and people issues, and take a look at how these affect individuals, teams, and whole organizations. 

You will come away with a number of actionable ideas, and deeper understanding of what makes teams fast or slow. 

Speaker:  Jean Barmash is currently Sr. Director of Engineering at Tradeshift, He has over 16 years of experience in software industry, and has been part of 4 startups over the last seven years, three as CTO / VPE and one of which he co-founded. Prior to his entrepreneurial adventures, Jean held a variety of progressively senior roles in development, integration consulting, training, and team leadership. 

Jean is passionate about raising the level of technical leadership, and for the last five years has been organizing CTO School New York meetup. Jean lives in NY with his awesome and supportive wife and two hilariously-funny kids.

Twitter @Jbarmash. 


As always, a group of us will hang out afterwards at a bar nearby.  


We like to hang out at Rye, which is at 11 W 17th St, New York, NY 10011, between Avenue of Americas and 5th.   They have both drinks and food.   http://ryehousenyc.com/
results.name: Engineering Teams and Systems for Velocity

Our weekly Meet Up will take place at Scotty's Steakhouse and Comedy Cove in Springfield, just a bit off of exit 9B on Route 24! The address is 595 Morris Ave, Springfield.


There is a world of gaming outside of the traditional Monopoly, Scrabble, Risk, etc. Whether you're looking for something new and different, or you're a seasoned gamer, you'll find a friendly and welcoming bunch of friends to game with.  Be adventurous , come learn some new games or play your favorites!

We begin gathering around 6:30 pm and are fully underway by 7pm.

Because the event takes place at a restaurant that serves alcohol, there are strict rules against gambling of any form.  Guests under 21 are welcome, as it is a restaurant. Since they are letting us use the space for free, they expect that we will order food and drink, so there are some rules:

1.  No outside food or drink, not even bottled water.

2. Please plan on ordering food and/or drinks.  Support the venue.

3. Tip the waitstaff generously.  15% is standard, but 20% is even better. We want them to love having us there, and in this case, money does buy you love.


4. If you plan on attending regularly, please consider a small contribution to cover The Tipsy Meeple's costs for using Meetup.

We bring some of our games, but feel free to bring your favorites, or learn one of ours! And don't be shy about learning new games, we are more than willing to teach a new player! Can't wait to see you there.

results.description:
Like our Facebook Page!:

    facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

Game description: 

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! 

VERY IMPORTANT: 

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


         “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.


Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play. 

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous. 

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game. 


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you: 
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee: 
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:


* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

                                            TAP a KEG

                                         2731 Broadway

                                     New York, NY 10025

                            Betwee[masked]th and Broadway  

By RSVP'ing you agree to our Liability waiver:

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT: 


I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. results.description:
A gentle introduction to the changes that Angular 2 brings, how they compare to Angular 1, and provides an understanding of the architecture and how the core concepts work together to build applications. You will learn how your Angular 1 skills translate and prepare you to build Angular 2 applications. Code samples focus on specific features including Angular 2 components, templates directives, data binding syntax, modules, dependency injection, routing, Http, pipes, and services. All samples are written in TypeScript and run live on the web where you can see and edit them with a click of a button; no setup required.

About The Author: John Papa is a Google Developer Expert, Microsoft Regional Director and MVP, author of 100+ articles and 10 books, and a former technology Evangelist for Microsoft client teams. He specializes in professional application development with technologies including HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, Angular, Gulp, Knockout, C#, and ASP.NET. He can often be found speaking around the world at keynotes and sessions for conferences such as ngConf, Build, MIX, PDC, TechEd, VSLive and AngleBrackets. John is a co-host of the popular Adventures in Angular podcast and formerly was the host of the show Silverlight TV on Channel 9 and hosted many events including the MIXer and Open Source Fest at major conferences. He currently enjoys authoring courses for Pluralsight. You can always find John at johnpapa.net or on twitter at @john_papa.
results.name: Angular 2: First Look - Week 2 of 3

We're excited to announce that the spring 2016 dates for the SibsNY Support Group have been set. Our first one will be Monday, March 14th 2016 from 630pm-8pm. 

As of right now the location remains the same as well - the YAI buildling on 460 W 34th Street on the 11th floor.  It is possible however that we might need to change locations, and if so, we will let you all know asap.

Thanks to everyone who was able to attend our meetup this past Monday evening - it was great to catch up with old friends and make new ones too. We hope to have another recreational event soon (perhaps near April 10th - which is National Siblings Day... more on that hopefully soon)!

We hope many of you will be able to make the monthly support group meetings. They are truly a great opportunity to experience the benefits of spending time with other sibs. It's a no judgement and on pressure zone - you are welcome to contribute or just sit and listen. Personally speaking, just being in the room with other sibs, for me, is extremely therapeutic. 

<3 Kristy


....................................................................................

Upcoming SibsNY support group meetings:

Monday, March 14th 2016

Monday, April 11th 2016

Monday, May 9th 2016

Monday, June 13th 2016

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Monday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

Most people arrive at 6:30pm.  We use the first 30 minutes to talk, order food/drinks, and pick out games while we wait for any people that are a little late.  Promptly at 7pm we split into groups and play our games that typically take 2 hours to play.  So, if you arrive after 7pm there is a good chance that you will not be able to get into a game and can watch us play if you'd like.  At the end of the night we play a couple of additional shorter games that you can get into.

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Kingsburg, Stone Age, Lords of Waterdeep, Istanbul, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Splendor, Pirate's Cove, Five Tribes, Castles of Burgundy, and more.  

Here is a list of the board games I own on the BGG website: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/MarkNY8?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Here is a list of Co-Host Kenny's games on BGG: 

https://boardgamegeek.com/collection/user/kenk1982?own=1&subtype=boardgame&ff=1

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's. We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Monday Night Board Games at Dave & Buster's!

These Psychic Development and Spirit contact classes are created for people who are passionate committed and sincere about developing their Intuition, Psychic abilities and contact with Spirit.

If you have always believed you are psychic, or have seen and felt Spirit during your life, or you feel compelled to explore this part of yourself- you will love this class. Please bring an open Spirit, curiosity, enthusiasm and a belief in the possibility of many Univeses, star systems and Spirit beings and ancestors..

In this class you will Experience:

. Meditation

. Developing Your Clairvoyance, Clairsentience, , Clairaudience, Clairscent, and Clairgustance.

. Work with Spirit Guides, Gate Keepers, Spirit Teams as well as ancestors and loved ones in Spirit.

. Explore Your Dreams for their deep , ancient and powerful symbols that connect you to the Spirit universe.

. Psychometry: Reading the energy imprints of objects as a way of focusing Psychic impressions and Mediumship.

. Photograph Readings: Tuning into the life experiences of people in photos beyond physical sight,  3D emotion, impressions to connect at a deeper level.

. Psychic and Mediumship Readings for other members of the class.

Developing your Intuition accelerates your success  in all areas of your life. Some people may choose to become professional Psychics and Mediums. Others will use their gifts to enhance business, career,relationships and learning about their life path and the universe we all live in

This is created for your development and for people share a passion for this work. Psychic and Mediumship Circles are most dynamic and powerful when people come on a continuous basis. 5 sequential weeks are a required starting point to see your development take off!!!!

After the 5 Week class, you can continue on, or take a break and come back..
results.name: Come Explore Your Psychic Super Powers and Connect to Spirit!!

The classes will bring together a community that inspires us, and pushes us to grow. In the Beginner Class you will learn the basics of using a pattern, sewing a hem, and how to use a machine. 


You will need to bring:
1 yard fabric for napkins (non stretch medium weight cotton- something that is washable and feels nice as a napkin)

I provide machines, thread, scissors and other materials.
If you can't buy fabric ahead of time you can buy fabric from me, but I do not have a large selection. 

This class will be $50 not including materials, payment will be taken at beginning of class. You should bring your own fabrics, if you do not have time, I have a limited selection of fabrics you can choose from at minimal extra cost.

Feel free to bring snacks and drinks.

results.description:
Event Host: Sergio, Please join & RSVP. </a><a href="http://www.meetup.com/Mere-Christianity-by-C-S-Lewis-Meetup/events/229185183/">http://www.meetup.com/Mere-Christianity-by-C-S-Lewis-Meetup/events/229185183/</a>

Trinity Grace Church East Village is starting a 4 week book study on Mere Christianity by C.S. Lewis. The thought behind the book study is that we have a healthy discussion. The hope is that the discussion won't be a debate, but more of a safe space for people to say their point of view and raise questions. We will talk about big life questions, such as: "how do we define our moral laws?", "how can God be good if He allows suffering or how can we say that God exists because there is suffering?" and other topics. ***You do not have to have read the whole book to come. We will focus on a couple pages/topic per week, and there will be printouts available. However, if you fill out the form below, you will receive the reading/topic over email before each Monday.*** |When: Mondays (Feb 29, March 7, March 14, and March 21) |Time: 7-8:30pm |Where: First Ukrainian Assembly of God New York City (59 Cooper Sq, New York, NY 10003) |*Wine and cheese will be provided each week! |Form to fill out: <a href="http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy">http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy

About the Event Host: Sergio is a members of Trinity Grace Church East Village, and he loves having philosophical discussions about topics we all think about - morality, the existence of God, the meaning of life, etc. He love hearing others thoughts about these things.
results.name: Discuss 'Mere Christianity' by C.S. Lewis (Part 3 of 4) - Host: Sergio

results.description:
Chers ami(e)s,

Thank you for making our now WEEKLY event "Jadore le French" a great success : c’était ma première surprise partie :-) Pictures posted below ! Let's meet again at Cellar Bar to speak French (or at least try a bit with Manhattans).

Special Thanks&HugsⓇ to the new members : you guys rock !Congratulations to Gabor and Abderaman, winners of the last raffle.

MegaHugsⓇ to Amelia, Hostess Etincelante, inventor of a new game using French quotes. 

French is not such a difficult language. If Rocky Balboa can speak Russian, if Rambo can speak Dari, then everybody can speak French, just a question of time :-) The new format "Jadore-le-French" is even nicer than our "Pardon-my-French" of last year.

To facilitate connections and meet&greets, we will have a special fun "lottery" :

Each of you will be given one of my polaroids (http://myinstantfilms.com/). Only TWO PAIRS will be identical. The 4 winners will get an invitation for two at Crepes & Delices, a brand new French crêperie located on 72nd and Columbus. THEY DO HAVE REAL GALETTES DE SARRASIN, AVIS AUX AMATEURS :

http://crepesanddelices.com


Come and get rewards by :

1. Dressing super nicely

2. Showing progress in your French skills (whatever you start from)

None of these are an obligation, neither a demand, just an incentive for rewards (perfumes, hats, free bottles of wine etc.).

Who are the organizers ? Yara, Handsome President, and Jean-Philippe, Glorieux Président. Since 3 weeks, Amelia, aka Superamelia, has joined the team as Hostess Étincelante.

IN THREE YEARS, WE HAVE ORGANIZED HUNDREDS OF SOCIAL EVENTS, FRENCH LESSONS/WORKSHOPS, FRENCH CONCERTS (including launching Flo, now superstar!) etc.

Pics from last Jadore le French :

Merci beaucoup et à lundi prochain !

-- Jean-Philippe, Yara, Amelia

results.description:
Join us for our weekly figure drawing session at The National Arts Club.

This session is open to all levels. Open to the public.

<a>Let us know you're coming.</a> 


We operate on a first come first served basis. Arriving by 6:45 is a good way to guarantee a seat.

• Bring your own drawing supplies.


• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break.

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp!

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes.

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there.

Simon

results.description:
• Awaken your body and mind’s innate healing powers 
• Develop healthier and more fulfilling relationships 
• Learn to work constructively with your own emotions 
• Stimulate your minds innate problem solving capabilities 
• Develop new resources and capabilities 
• Become clear about your life’s purpose 
Develop your intuition by tapping into the innate intelligence that resides within your body and mind 
Our bodies communicate with us all the time. Many of us are so over stimulated and stressed out that we cannot hear what our bodies are saying. We age faster and suffer many health problems when we do not know how to listen to what our body is telling us. 
Discover the amazing wisdom that resides within your own body. Ben will show you how to develop your sensory awareness. Learn to truly listen to your body and care for its needs. 
Stimulate the mind's creative problem solving capabilities by learning to "digest" issues, emotions and stresses 
Many of us have never learned how to work with difficult issues and emotions. We tend to push these things down inside of ourselves. Undigested thoughts, issues, emotions and the stresses of daily life create a residue that accumulates within the tissues and organs of our bodies. That creates a great deal of additional stress upon our body and mind. These stresses can arrest our process of development, disconnect us from the divine creative intelligence of the universe and shut down our intuition. It also causes our bodies break down at a more rapid pace and that accelerates the aging process.

Learn to use your body-mind's innate healing power to "digest and assimilate" your thoughts feelings, emotions, issues and life experiences. You will begin to release the stresses that are held within the body and to heal the painful emotions associated with anxiety, depression and emotionally traumatic experiences. You will also learn to go right to the source of the issues to bring about a resolution that allows you to really move forward in your life. 
Working with these practices helps to increase your intellectual and emotional range, improve memory, initiate new cycles of growth, awaken inner passions, spark creativity and deepen intuition. You will develop the strength and resilience that will make it easier for you to adapt to the demands that life places upon you. 
Discover the passion and power that resides within you 
Chinese Martial Arts Masters emphasize the development of a base of power known as the "dan tien". The stress of living in such a fast paced world can cause us to disconnect from our foundation. Undigested food, emotions and the stresses of daily life begin to accumulate within the abdomen. We may experience bloating and suffer from various digestive problems. Some of us begin to lose touch with our drive, passion, inspiration and the sense of knowing that reveals our true purpose as our instinctual base shuts down.

You will learn to become fully present within your body, to develop greater personal power, and to awaken the inner passion and sense of knowing that will bring give you a greater sense of clarity about your life's purpose.

Activate the healing intelligence that resides within the body and mind 
We all have a powerful healing intelligence that resides within our bodies and minds. This innate healing power helps to mend our bodies any time we suffer an illness or injury. Our innate healing powers are often compromised by the stress and toxins that accumulate within our bodies. 
Learn to activate the generative healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Awaken the consciousness of the individual organs. Access and heal the emotions and core issues that are held within the body. These practices are very effective for healing digestive and respiratory disorders and a wide range of other health issues.


Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can awaken the healing powers that reside within your own body and mind. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.
results.name: Awaken the Healing Power Within Your Body and Mind

results.description:
• Heal the emotional wounds of past relationships
• Transform deep seated patterns of abandonment and rejection
• Let go of unhealthy dysfunctional relationships
• Develop the ability to remain centered in the core of your being
• Become truly loving and accepting of yourself
• Develop a warm magnetic presence that will draw others to you
• Cultivate inner beauty
• Increase your capacity to give and receive love
• Attract a healthy and loving partner
• Create healthier and more fulfilling relationships
• Develop a stronger connection with the higher power
• Learn to evolve spiritually through your relationships


My friend Sema was telling me about how she had fallen for a man, but he had not called her in some time. Sema told me that she felt this man would come back to her somewhere down the road. Yet she also acknowledged that on another level she was experiencing a fear of loss and that she didn’t feel that there was much hope for the relationship. Sema told me later that evening that she could never seem to hold onto the men that she truly wanted to be with.

Sema was obviously strung out on the man, but she was very disconnected from the underlying pain that was driving her. Sema’s head was just spinning in circles as she analyzed everything the man said or did and why he wasn’t with her at that time. I could see that the hurt buried within Sema was keeping her attached to the man in a very unhealthy way…

Does this sound familiar?

Many of us are struggling to find love. But no matter what we do, love always seems to evade us.

I’ve been there myself and I didn’t know if I would ever find the love that I desired. But I persevered because I was very determined to heal and have someone special in my life. I discovered a series of practices that have enabled me to heal the emotional wounds and to develop a magnetic presence. These practices are making it possible for me to attract more loving partners and to create healthier and more fulfilling relationships. I have now decided to share these practices and understandings so that others can also create more love and intimacy and to attract someone truly special.

Open Your Heart by Healing the Emotional Wounds That Carry Over From Childhood and Past Loves
Most of us are still carrying the emotional wounds from our childhood and our past loves. We try to block the hurtful feelings and memories out of our awareness. But these feelings and experiences remain trapped within our body and mind. We then give off a vibe that causes us to attract and become attracted to dysfunctional people who create even more confusion, pain and suffering in our lives.

Learn to “digest” the emotional baggage that keeps you trapped in unfulfilling relationships. Transform the deep seated patterns that cause you to attract people who are negative or abusive or who do not have the capacity to truly love you and be present with you.

Heal the loss of past loves. Heal the shame and the feelings unworthiness, rejection and abandonment. Become clearer about what you really want in life and in a companion. You will naturally attract and find yourself attracted to healthier people as you heal the wounded parts of yourself. More and more love will flow to you as you begin to experience true love and acceptance for yourself. Working with these practices will make it possible for you to cultivate inner beauty and to develop a presence that is very healing to others.

Develop the Kind of Warm Magnetic Presence That Will Attract a Healthy and Loving Partner
Many of us have learned to disconnect from our emotions and are not very present within our bodies. The stresses, emotions and life experiences that we fail to digest accumulate within our body and mind. These stagnant energies and emotions can extinguish our inner fire and passion. Stagnant energies decrease our desirability which makes us less attractive to others.

A body that if full of vital life force is infinitely more desirable. Become powerfully present while remaining centered within the core of your being. Exude warmth, passion, sensuality and desire.

Develop Your Intuition and Sensory Awareness
Heightened intuition and sensory awareness lets us know when it is safe for us to open up to another person. It helps us to understand where people are coming from. Our intuition also guides us to the people that we are meant to be with.

Use Your Relationships to Evolve Spiritually
Healing the hurts and resolving the issues awakens the part of the soul that resides within your body. Awakening your body-mind will enable you to develop a stronger connection with your higher self and the universal consciousness.

Develop Chi Power
Many systems of Chinese martial arts emphasize the development of the dan tien, which is our base of power in the lower abdomen. You will learn specific chi gong practices that will enable you to continually cultivate the chi/shakthi in the dan tien. Developing Chi Power enables you to create a powerful magnetic presence that draws others to you.

Create Healthier and More Fulfilling Relationships
Relationships have a way of bringing our core issues to the surface. Buried emotions and unresolved issues create barriers between ourselves and others. Our love grows stronger and our understanding deepens as we learn to “digest” our emotions, resolve important issues and express our feelings and needs in a healthy way.

Ben was drawn to indigenous cultures from an early age and found himself living among the Kiowa Tribe in Oklahoma at the age of seventeen. He began his training with Horace Daukei, the last surviving traditional doctor (medicine man) among the Kiowa Tribe. Ben went on to study with Chinese Master Li Tai Liang. He continues to train intensively in the Chinese systems of xin yi, bagua, tai chi and chi gong.

Please go to http://www.doiohm.com... or call (913)[masked] for more information

I'm working out in the field much of the time and I have very limited access to the internet. Please call me at (913)[masked] if you have any questions and are interested in attending. I will be happy to answer any questions that you have about how you can heal from the loss of a love and develop a more attractive presence. Let me know in advance about your individual needs and concerns and we will address these issues during class.

Sign up for my free monthly internet journal at http://www.doiohm.com...

Please go to http://www.facebook.com/healthyandlovingrelationships

and click on the LIKE button at the top of the page to join the community and gain access to new articles.

Event Host: Sergio, http://www.meetup.com/Mere-Christianity-by-C-S-Lewis-Meetup/events/229185183/

Trinity Grace Church East Village is starting a 4 week book study on Mere Christianity by C.S. Lewis. The thought behind the book study is that we have a healthy discussion. The hope is that the discussion won't be a debate, but more of a safe space for people to say their point of view and raise questions. We will talk about big life questions, such as: "how do we define our moral laws?", "how can God be good if He allows suffering or how can we say that God exists because there is suffering?" and other topics. ***You do not have to have read the whole book to come. We will focus on a couple pages/topic per week, and there will be printouts available. However, if you fill out the form below, you will receive the reading/topic over email before each Monday.*** |When: Mondays (Feb 29, March 7, March 14, and March 21) |Time: 7-8:30pm |Where: First Ukrainian Assembly of God New York City (59 Cooper Sq, New York, NY 10003) |*Wine and cheese will be provided each week! |Form to fill out: http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy

About the Event Host:  Sergio is a members of Trinity Grace Church East Village, and he loves having philosophical discussions about topics we all think about - morality, the existence of God, the meaning of life, etc. He loves hearing others thoughts about these things.

results.description:
First Valentine's Day, and now White Day! For this event, the theme is love songs! Maybe you'll be able to sneak in a confession...?

バレンタインデーに続いてホワイトデーのイベント！今回のテーマは「ラブソング」です！気になるあの子に告っちゃいなよ！

------------------------------------------------------------


Group Rules

1) This is a Japanese-English karaoke group, which means you must sing at least one or two songs in Japanese.  Please do not join if you only want to sing English songs.

2) Please RSVP or make sure it is okay with the organizer first before coming.  This is due to room-size limitations. The organizers reserve the right to deny entry to anyone who shows up without notice.

3) Please bring ID with you to prove that you are over 21 years of age. 

4) Please go in clockwise order one by one when selecting songs to sing, so everyone has an equal opportunity.  This also makes it easy to tell if your song is skipped (in which case you can choose two songs upon your next turn).  Please try to locate your song choice before getting the remote to keep it moving along (<a>https://www.clubdam.com/app/search/searchKeywordKaraoke.html). </a> As soon as you enter your song, please pass the remote directly to the next person, and let them know it is their turn. 

5) Please tip the staff at karaoke.

6) If you leave an early, please give your payment (including tip) to the organizer, who will take care of the bill at the end.  Please bring cash with you to make splitting bills and tipping easier.

7) If you are a no-show, you are subject to removal from the group.  It is understandable if something comes up and you cannot make it, but when this happens, please either email the organizer or change your status on the event page to "not attending".

results.description:
Hello meetup members of Bojagi and traditional Korean craft arts,

Create your own Korean/Asian Knotting bracelet/necklace at a workshop in Manhattan next Saturday. You can learn how to make your own modern artistic and practical works using traditional silk knots.
Join us. After learning the knots, you can make knot pin, necklace, hairpin and so on. For more information,visit the photo albums of Korean traditional knots on meetup.com

Space is limited. RSVP required. Date and Time: Saturday, March 14/ 7-8:30pm /$20(includes materials)

Place: 69 Charlton Street(SOHO), New York, NY10014

Maedeup, the traditional Korean knot, developed into a distinctive decorative art and practical use through its long history. It was used in not only fashion, household and ritual items but also court ceremonies, the lives of the common people. It was also used to adorn musical instruments, fans, dresses, flags and palanquins. Today, knots are widely used as modern ornaments in accessories and for art as follows.

Thank you so much,
KJ Ahn

Add some variety to your running -- do some speed work on the track! Think you're slow? This is the best way to get faster. Nobody is too slow to try a track workout. This is how you will improve.

We encourage runners of all ability levels to join. You are not too slow! If you are a even a little bit intimidated by the thought of running laps at the track we want to challenge you to come join us and find out just how awesome it actually is. You will feel great (and exhausted) at the end of the workout. Guaranteed!


The East River Park Track is just across the FDR highway at the end of 6th street. Just walk across the pedestrian overpass and the track will be right there.


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. We pile all our stuff together and are (relatively) nearby for the duration of the workout. We have never had a problem with theft, but that doesn't mean it won't happen.


After the workout join us for beer at ABC Beer Co. at Ave C between 6th and 7th.

results.description:
PLEASE READ:

Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7-7:05 - chat

7:05-7:30 - introductions (please be on time for intros)

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

See you there.
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
UPDATE:  Saying yes to this meet up page doesn't guarantee your entry to the class unfortunately!  Please go to QED website shown below to register to guarantee your spot!!  (The last two sessions were sold out).  Looking forward to dancing with you! 

*********************************

Our next monthly Beginner Lesson starts on March 14th Monday!!  Last series were sold out, so please go to QED website and register asap to reserve your spot!!   By the way, QED offers a gift certificate.  Would be a great gift for your Valentine : ) 

**********************************

Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet! This month, we will be learning 8 count footwork using triple steps!

We will meet every Monday from 7:10pm to 8:00pm (March 14, 21, 28, April 4) so that you will be comfortable with the basic steps of swing dancing. 

If you already have some experience with swing dancing, please check out the Advanced Beginner class starting at 6:30. 

We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!! You will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves to authentic 30's and 40's jazz music. 

Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor. Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it! 

Classes are taught by Akemi Kinukawa and Andrew Kontola, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.Facebook.com/swingdanceastoria). 

Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot! Register here: http://qedastoria.com/collections/michael-duke-akemi-kinukawa
Looking forward to dancing with you!

Alfie Hanssen, Vimeo’s Director of Mobile & TV Apps Engineering, will present on their new soon-to-be-open-source video system.

~~~~~

Longtime iOSoho stalwart Mike Sanderson will present on "Defensive Coding against APIs":


iOS apps often depend on web services, and developing iOS apps reliant on web services can become a frustrating experience when those services are also still in development, are unreliable, or go down altogether. Michael Sanderson of Fuzz Productions will talk about some strategies using Swift 2 to protect against instability and manage the complexity of APIs.


~~~~~

Vimeo / IAC is located on 18th St between 10th & 11th Ave – across from Chelsea Piers.  Please enter on 18th Street and check in at the Vimeo table.   


Doors open at 6:30pm.  

Travel tip: the M14D bus runs across 14th St. from 2nd Ave to 11th Ave. If walking from the 8th Ave. subway station, allow 10 additional minutes travel time.

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/1If0_vJTLHPu13PbxJ078F2vYSlSCEN0KlxVJSwJ8eiLtdRD2wdkyHlPaEV-WgeQejOqoXR68QYMENpMozTAaOCke7Zded6exj-DtzPjpAckbD5Qa-dsuWac0Og3V3UKufF8NgXJ Join Be Social Change & Kristina Drury, founder of TYTHEdesign, on Monday, March 14th from 7PM to 9PM for Design Thinking Fundamentals - Problem Solving for Impact.

Curious about design thinking and how you can adapt it for your work? Design thinking is a problem-solving, idea generating, decision making mindset that is applicable and useful in all disciplines, not just the design field! After years of integrating the design thinking process into their daily work, TYTHEdesign has tailored a class focused on how their theories translate across fields and sectors into real world, real work experience.

===========================================

LIMITED TICKETS AVAILABLE! This is a paid class. Be sure to purchase your ticket here: http://bit.ly/BSCdesignMar14

===========================================

* Doors open at 6:45, class starts at 7:00 sharp *


Design thinking is a user-centered methodology that helps you to empathize with your clients or community, design to their needs, and experiment with solutions. In this class you will not only learn the tenets of design thinking, but how they can translate into your day-to-day work and interactions with your team. Through activities, case studies and interactive modeling, this class will demystify design thinking and translate it into adaptable strategies to help you innovate within your team, enhance new and existing services, and better connect with your community. This class will help you take design thinking from theory to practice.

WHAT YOU'LL LEARN

• An interactive introduction to design thinking

• A process for generating new ideas and ways to efficiently brainstorm

• How to build the capacity for user-centered empathy

• Strategies and resources that can be easily customized to your work and community

WHO THIS CLASS IS FOR

• Individuals from all professional or educational backgrounds interested in learning about the design thinking process

• Managers looking for tools to activate collaboration within their teams

• Early stage entrepreneurs or those considering starting a socially-minded venture

• Professionals who have an idea for a project, organization or business that will drive social changeIndividuals looking to add creative thinking methodology to their work

INSTRUCTOR BIO

https://lh4.googleusercontent.com/3aFiMB9DK24Lk63e1fTvsZZNdyDCg9UmgzQRBAyFQNoAHnZsLnLSp_JT5ry1YV-hp1oxqjIDyYE40KSJx2t90kB91ZsJG-YJbhQhDheqaFOJ-fXVvVxYy2E9jzhPin3HRGrDRJ4

Kristina Drury (@TYTHEdesign) founder of TYTHEdesign, is a social entrepreneur, designer and educator. TYTHE, a social impact firm, uses the lens of design and strategy to support organizations build their capacity in the social good community. Under her leadership TYTHE has increased the community impact of over 75 local and global social good organizations including the NYC Dept. of Education, Citi Community Development, Public Policy Lab and California State Library System. Recently, Kristina has been named a UNDP Innovation Expert. Prior to starting TYTHE, Kristina co-led the nonprofit Project H and worked in corporate social responsibility consulting. As an educator she has taught classes, workshops and training to build the capacity of over 600 change-makers, leaders, and entrepreneurs. Her teaching and speaking experience includes engagements at the Clinton Global Initiative University, Cooper-Hewitt Museum and New Museum’s Ideas City Festival.

You can learn about Kristina’s current work here and find out more about her background here.

SPACE PARTNER


The Centre for Social Innovation (@csiSL) is a home for nonprofits and social entrepreneurs in New York City. They’re building a movement of passionate people committed to a better world. Learn more at http://nyc.socialinnovation.org/

Refund Policy: Refunds can be issued in full up to 48 hours prior to the start of the class by contacting Be Social Change.
results.name: BSC Class: Design Thinking Fundamentals - Problem Solving for Impact

results.description:
Clark is a seasoned entrepreneur who has become a mainstay in the New Jersey startup ecosystem.

He has excelled at multiple corporate positions as well as built several companies within the healthcare space—a core NJ industry. He’s a “get it done” guy, and is responsible for taking his current startup from idea to profit within the first 18 months. When not improving patient health and wellness through products, he devotes his time to creating communities that support entrepreneurs, as well as mentoring dozens of startups throughout the state.

Even with such a full plate, Clark has spent much of his “free” time in the last year training for the 140.6 mile IronMan competition, considered by many to be the most challenging endurance race in the world, and one for which he has raised thousands of dollars for the Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation.

results.description: Trinity Grace Church East Village is starting a 4 week book study on Mere Christianity by C.S. Lewis. The thought behind the book study is that we have a healthy discussion. The hope is that the discussion won't be a debate, but more of a safe space for people to say their point of view and raise questions. We will talk about big life questions, such as: "how do we define our moral laws?", "how can God be good if He allows suffering or how can we say that God exists because there is suffering?" and other topics. ***You do not have to have read the whole book to come. We will focus on a couple pages/topic per week, and there will be printouts available. However, if you fill out the form below, you will receive the reading/topic over email before each Monday.*** |When: Mondays (Feb 29, March 7, March 14, and March 21) |Time: 7-8:30pm |Where: First Ukrainian Assembly of God New York City (59 Cooper Sq, New York, NY 10003) |*Wine and cheese will be provided each week! |Form to fill out: http://bit.do/merechristianitystudy

results.description:
Stressed? Overwhelmed? Always Worrying? Stuck in Negative Thought Patterns?

Come Experience the Benefits of Meditation & Mindfulness with us!

Just like we use exercise to maximize the health and fitness of our bodies, we also need to train our mind and emotions.

Current science supports the benefit of mindfulness for a variety of physical and mental health conditions, and for the general challenges of life in the 21st century. Research shows mindfulness can impact life positively in the following ways:

Reduce stress
Reduce chronic physical pain
Boost the immune system
Reduce emotional reactivity
Increase self-awareness
Improve attention and concentration
Enhance positive emotions
Cultivate well-being and happiness
Positively impact the brain

If you're new to meditation, don't get caught up in the "how". Join us to discuss many different ways to relax your body and mind to create more mindfulness in your everyday life! Meditation & Mindfulness Class
Every Monday at 7pm
$10 donation per class

About Enviromental Green Drinks Gatherings

Environmental Green Drinks is an informal monthly get-together for people interested in green living, sustainable business and building communities that are safe for living, biking, walking and growing food. We meet at places where the food is excellent and the prices are good.

Green Drinks are open, admission is free and new faces are always welcome, so come and join us some evening!

Acerca de las Reuniones Green Drinks

Green Drinks es un informal evento social para gente interesada en la sostenibilidad y el medio ambiente. Las reuniones facilitan el intercambio informal de ideas y estrategias "verdes" y colaboraciones comunitarias e individuales. Conversamos sobre alternativos fuentes de energía limpia, producción agrícola urbana, la comida natural y orgánica, comprar local, los empleos verdes. . . y la justicia ambiental. Nuestros encuentros están abiertos a la comunidad y todos encontrarán una calurosa bienvenida.

Os Eventos Green Drinks

Green Drinks é um evento social informal para dialogar sobre o estabelecimento duma sociedade sustentável, justa e no qual os comerciantes e indivíduos respeitam os recursos da terra e seus habitantes. A comunidade está muito bem vinda!

results.description:
Learn From 3.11 and CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing) invite you to the NYC premiere of “Alone in Fukushima” (2014, Japanese w/ English subtitles, 98′). This feature-length documentary chronicles the astonishing story of Naoto Matsumura, who struggles to survive with the numerous animals abandoned in a small town inside the evacuated zone surrounding the Fukushima nuclear plant meltdown.

We are honored to have Director/Editor/Cinematographer Mayu Nakamura present to answer questions following the film. 

Tickets are $15 and are available online, by phone [masked]), and in person at CRS.

Ostriches, cows, hogs, cats, a pony and a dog…Animals roam freely in lush greenery in the evacuated nuclear zone. And there is one man who stayed behind, creating his own Eden. 55 year-old Naoto Matsumura lives alone with these animals in Tomioka, a town located only 12 kilometers away from the melted-down nuclear power plant. In the last few years, Naoto has been the focus of media attention, being covered by CNN, ARTE and other major overseas networks. But due to government restrictions, his story has remained largely untold in the Japanese media. 

https://youtu.be/HRhl4u-_AG4


Until now, there has never been a feature-length documentary film on him and the reality of life in the exclusion zone. An accidental hero or a fool on the hill? Naoto is an ever-intriguing, complex person who has firmly remained behind in his hometown-a place Japan is trying to erase from the map. “Alone in Fukushima” follows his life with animals in the zone over the course of a year.

http://aloneinfukushima.com

Learn From 3.11 was founded in 2011 to create an opportunity for people to study together about the actual situations in the disaster-stricken area and the related radiation problems by periodically holding seminars and events.
results.how_to_find_us: above Think Coffee (look for the brown door to the right/south of Think and ring the bottom buzzer)
results.name: Screen & Discuss Alone in Fukushima

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:

results.description: The purpose of this group is to establish a safe place where people can deal with the pain and isolation brought about by the ending of a significant relationship. We are not a singles group or a dating network. Instead, we are a family where it is safe to be ourselves. The goal of the meeting is to help members to develop into healthier, more complete, independent, loving men and women. We hope that by being together, listening to each other, and by sharing our experiences, strength and hope, we will learn to see the value of life in a new context. For the first hour of each meeting members share their experiences. The second half of the meeting is reserved for a guest speaker relating to either the legal or emotional aspects of separation/divorce. We meet every Monday eveing at the Church in the Highlands, 35 Bryant Ave. White Plains, New York. We are a mixed group of men and women. There are about 50 members, with approximately 20 attendees per meeting. There are no fees, new members are welcome, no reservation is necessary. We pass a basket at each meeting and suggest a five dollar donation per meeting to cover the cost of the meeting place and coffee/cookies served at the meeting.
results.name: Separation and Divorce Recovery Group Weekly Meetup

results.description:
Me Before You, by Jojo Moyes

Louisa Clark is an ordinary girl living an exceedingly ordinary life -- steady boyfriend, close family -- who has barely been farther afield than her tiny village. She takes a badly needed job working for ex-Master of the Universe Will Traynor, who is wheelchair-bound after an accident. Will has always lived a huge life, big deals, extreme sports, worldwide travel—and he is not interested in exploring a new one.

Will is acerbic, moody, bossy.  But Lou refuses to treat him with kid gloves, and soon his happiness means more to her than she expected. When she learns that Will has shocking plans of his own, Lou sets out to show him that life is still worth living.

Me Before You brings to life two people who couldn’t have less in common, a heartbreakingly romantic novel that asks, What do you do when making the person you love happy also means breaking your own heart?

I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at Think Coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 6 students per group and costs $10/person if more than 3 people come to the class and $15/person if 1 to 3 people come to the class.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lof of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation Intermediate. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

Game description:

Teams are 4 V 4, no goalies, no gender requirements (but we'd like at least 1 female player per team). Games will be played on a 1st goal rotation basis or 15 minutes time limit. The team that scores first stays on  the field. But if your team remains on the field after scoring 3 goals, we'll split the team up so that everyone has a fair chance to have a great game.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

VERY IMPORTANT:

- NO FOULS

- NO SIDE TACKLING

- NO PUSHING

- NO TELLING OFF

* ZERO TOLERANCE*


By minimizing physical contact, we minimize injuries and violence.


“Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!

We encourage competitive, but safe play.

We reserve the right to ask anyone to leave who has exhibited any behavior that could be construed as violent, offensive, or dangerous.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.


Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board, 10 PM the night before to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

West End Presbyterian Church

165 West 105th Street, New York, NY

Near the lines: 1, 2, 3, B, and C trains.

AS YOU COME IN, TAKE THE STAIRS ON YOUR LEFT AND WALK TO THE 4TH FLOOR.

Call me if you can’t find us - (917)[masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers or INDOOR shoes (ONLY), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:
You will be asked to pay $9.25 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.25 dollars is used to pay for: permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, Goals, soccer balls etc.

Refund Policy:

* The Meetup is cancelled

* You can cancel at least 2 day(s) before the Meetup


Very IMPORTANT Due to the location where we will be playing:

We expect everyone to respect the facilities and act accordingly.

Anyone who is asked to leave will not be refunded and WILL be permanently banned from the group

After the game we can go for a quick drink at:

TAP a KEG

2731 Broadway

New York, NY 10025

Betwee[masked]th and Broadway

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E
results.name: TurnON Games @ Tribeca

results.description:
This group meets on the second Monday of each month to discuss a specific mystery,suspense, or intrigue novel.


Trigger Warning explores the masks we all wear and the people we are beneath them to reveal our vulnerabilities and our truest selves. Here is a rich cornucopia of horror and ghosts stories, science fiction and fairy tales, fabulism and poetry that explore the realm of experience and emotion. In Adventure Story—a thematic companion to The Ocean at the End of the Lane—Gaiman ponders death and the way people take their stories with them when they die. His social media experience A Calendar of Tales are short takes inspired by replies to fan tweets about the months of the year—stories of pirates and the March winds, an igloo made of books, and a Mother’s Day card that portends disturbances in the universe. Gaiman offers his own ingenious spin on Sherlock Holmes in his award-nominated mystery tale The Case of Death and Honey. And Click-Clack the Rattlebag explains the creaks and clatter we hear when we’re all alone in the darkness.
results.name: Suspense Central:  Trigger Warnings by Neil Gaiman

group.name: The Science Fiction Society of Northern New Jersey

results.description:
What if accessing your desire is the thing that can truly give you fulfillment? What if real health and deep intimate relationships only comes from a life lived in accordance with what your body wants? Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC? We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact [masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

We probably get 5-10 phone calls per week from investors who have an owner financed note that they are looking to sell. Unfortunately, most note sellers don't have a note that they can sell due to how they've structured the deal. So we are bringing in one of the nation's largest buyer of owner financed notes to help educate you on the best way to structure your owner financed deal to make it more marketable on the secondary market!

We'll be talking with Daniel Malcolm, Acquisitions Manager from First National Acceptance Corporation, on how and what you should do when structuring an owner financed note to make it more attractive to note buyers! We'll talk about balloons, Dodd Frank, seasoning and a ton of other items to help you in your note business!

This is a meeting for people who have, or who have had at some point in the past, a good grasp of Latin grammar. If you had a few years of Latin in high school 20 years ago, chances are you'll be able to catch up without too much trouble. If you're just starting out, it might not be your cup of tea.

For next week, read from line 139 to the end of Capitulum 41 of Lingua Latína II: Roma Æterna, and, if you like, reread Capitulum 2 of Familia Romana. Texts are downloadable at Lingua Latina per se Illustrata or for sale at Focus. Other resources are available at the website with videos and the flashcard website.

Macte virtúte!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. results.description:
Join in on NYSR Summer Distance Reiki Shares!

Boost your work week! RSVP to participate in the NYSR Distance Reiki Shares! With “Right Mind and Intention”, Distance Reiki sessions are as effective as sessions conducted in person.


These Summer Reiki Shares are a group effort of Practitioners who collaborate for the benefit of healing, supporting our personal lives, and enhancing the development of Reiki Skills, including sensitivity to giving and receiving Reiki.

AND YOU CAN DO THIS FROM HOME!

Mondays at 10PM for 45 minutes, we practice Distance Reiki among all participants that RSVP. Angela and I prepare “space” 15 minutes prior to start time and your participation will involve the following:

1. Sit or Lay comfortably and quietly.

2. *Set your intent to heal yourself and others participating to receive
whatever is needed for healing to take place.

3. Hold the space for energy to flow, remembering your own
connection to “Oneness” which supports the flow of energy
between the practitioner and recipient.

4. Once your ready and  receptive to receive, set your intent to begin sharing Reiki.

*Participant names will be forwarded via email or text if you prefer. Please use firstname and lastname initial (i.e.Michelle D.) or your Meetup ID Name.when you RSVP. Guest welcome and must RSVP individually; also required to submit (min) $10 donation via PayPal.

There is no “cancellation of energy”. Each individual receives as much Reiki needed at the present time to assist with the unique situations of his/her own life.
results.how_to_find_us: In you're own comfort space.

results.description:
Do you own your own business? Are you starting a new business? Are you a very seasoned business professional? Do you want to get MOVING on your 2016 Biz-Goals right now?!


No matter what the answer to any of those questions, we have the meeting for you: New Frontier-26 (Manhattan BNI Chapter 26). We are a group of 37 (and growing!) NYC-based top-notch business-owners and business-development professionals who are all committed to helping grow each others' businesses. We launched less than 7 months ago and will be 80 members by August 1st! That's a promise.


Our Motto: Givers Gain.


The more we give to each other, the more the large group gives back to us! We allow one person per professional-classification (e.g. Social-Media expert, SEO, Graphic Designer, Photographer, and tons more) to actually JOIN our group.....but EVERYONE is invited to visit!


You will get the opportunity to stand and give a short under 1-minute commercial that gives the entire group of members and visitors a simple example of what they should be listening for.  And who they know! We typically have about 10 visitors per meeting, so that's an audience of 45-55 people you're talking to before 9am!


Visitors to our meeting typically walk away with any or all of the following:

• Leads/Referrals on possible new deals

• Contacts in professions they didn't know before but needed, and best of all....

• A full stomach! (Our meetings have delicious hot-eggs, bacon, fruit, bagels, yogurt.....and coffee. Lots and lots of coffee!)


We meet every Tuesday morning (except holidays) from 7am - 8:45am here: Sinigual Restaurant
41st and 3rd Ave
(640 Third Ave)
Manhattan New York, NY 10017


Cost: $20 per Visit (cash or credit-card)


When the structured part of the meeting ends at 8:40, there'll be plenty of time to talk to anyone in an "open-networking" ennvironment afterwards!

If you have business-cards, you can pass them around. We recommend bringing a stack of at least 40! But if you don't have business-cards yet....don't worry! The people who you want to talk with and who want to talk with you....you'll get all the opportunity you need.

That's all! If you're ready to get more accomplished on a Tuesday morning than you ever have before, come visit New Frontier-26, the ultimate Manhattan networking group.

(Note: your office or territory does not need to be in Manhattan to attend....ALL professionals)

results.name: New Frontier-26 (NYC Business Networking - BNI)

results.description:
Professional Business Networking Event in Elmhurst, Queens.

The BNI Dream Team. 

As a reminder here's why we wake up early Tuesday mornings. 98% of businesses rely on referrals to build new business. ONLY 3% of businesses have a strategy to generate those referrals. Our BNI networking meetings are a proven word of mouth marketing referral generating strategy. Last year, members of BNI (Business Networking International) passed millions of referrals that generated billions of dollars of business for each other. Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of salespeople representing your business, and in return you are representing their businesses. What goes around comes around. If I help you, you’ll help me and we will both benefit as a result.

The reason  BNI is so successful is that there is only one person per profession per chapter. If your profession is listed below we invite you to come check us out and show you how we can help you grow your business.

BNI Dream Team is currently looking for these professions to pass a boat load of business to. 

IT Professional, Title Insurance, Moving Company, Reverse Mortgage Broker, DJ Entertainment Company, Florist, Photographer, Caterer, General Contractor, Event Planner, Personal Trainer, Architect, Hair Salon, Nutritionist, Life Coach, Commercial Real Estate Broker, Business Broker.

If your profession falls under any of the above titles I strongly encourage you to come check us out!

Here are the details for our next meeting Tuesday, October 20th 2015

Meeting time is from 7:00AM to 8:30AM

Our Location: Nevada Diner 80-26 Queens Blvd, Elmhurst, NY 11374 (718) 426-2229.

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.


We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Come join us for an invigorating breakfast and networking event.

There will be at least 15 members at each meeting, regardless of how many people RSVP on Meetup.

Meet successful business owners from different professions to give and pass referrals and grow your personal network.

BNI, the largest business networking organization in the world, is a business and professional referral organization that allows only one person from each profession to join a chapter.  Belonging to BNI is like having dozens of sales people working for you because all the other members carry several copies of your business cards around with them. When they meet someone who could use your products or services they hand your card out and recommend your services. It's as simple as that!  

For 28 years BNI has used a simple but elegant philosophy that exemplifies membership, "Givers Gain," or, "what goes around comes around."

 Last year alone, Business Network Int'l generated over 7.1 million referrals resulting in more than $3.3 billion worth of business for its members!

In Manhattan, BNI currently has more than 1250 members in 53 Chapters. 

BRING LOTS OF BUSINESS CARDS!!!
Cost is $20, which includes breakfast.
