results.description:
We are grateful for the large turnout last Tuesday evening and hope more will be able to share their divine presence with the group this coming Tuesday. Our topic last week was "Projection Makes Perception" and we read from Chapter 3 - Perception Versus Knowledge.


This week we'll share ideas regarding the Undoing of Beliefs. The power of our belief system seems to create a world and an image of ourselves we think we "know" and keeps us from seeing things truly.


From Lesson 132


I loose the world from all I thought it was.

What keeps the world in chains but your beliefs? And what can save the world except your Self? Belief is powerful indeed. The thoughts you hold are mighty, and illusions are as strong in their effects as is the truth. A madman thinks the world he sees is real, and does not doubt it. Nor can he be swayed by questioning his thoughts' effects. It is but when their source is raised to question that the hope of freedom comes to him at last.

We hope you'll join us to question the source of our beliefs on Tuesday at 7pm. Let us come together and open our minds to True vision which is beyond any and all beliefs.
results.how_to_find_us: Take the 1 train to the 86st stop. Jeff's building is on 86th street near riverside dr. The apartment (15f) will be unlocked. Please take off your shoes before entering.
results.name: ACIM - The Undoing of Beliefs

Aside from our League play we offer Open Play 6 days a week. 1 hour and 45 minute sessions only $11 midweek.

Format: 3 teams of 5 per court. Score by 1’s. Games to 7. Winner stays but must sit after 2 games. No refs. Call your own. Our moderator will help things along. All players must bring a white and a dark shirt (not grey). This is a friendly run. Anyone with the wrong attitude will not be allowed back. Age: 21+

Our open runs are designed for good fun and a run. The A / B breakdown is purely a self rating device to try and split things up in an enjoyable manner. Think of it as if you were going to the park to play. If you are average or above go to the A court. If you are average or below go to B.  It is not exact. There is always going to be some crossover.  

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space. Just click the session that interests you.


http://nyurban.com/open-play-basketball/

We will send you a confirmation email. Show up at the Gym with I.D. We will have you on our list but please bring your receipt. No payment at the door.

results.description:
This month we'll feature the following presentations:

Bob Helmond will give an overview of Tor, the free software and open network that allows users to browse the Internet anonymously.

Jerry Glacken will give a demonstration of Tails, the live operating system designed to protect your privacy and anonymity. It helps you to use the Internet anonymously and circumvent censorship almost anywhere you go and on any computer but leaves no trace.

Bruce Mittelman will give a demonstration of Smart Photo Editor, the application designed to make it as easy as possible for users of all levels to achieve creative results with their photos.

George Ajjan will give his inaugural edition of "Three Things To Know On Your Mac " in which he'll show interesting tips and tricks that anyone can use to improve their Macintosh workflows. This month George will show three interesting and easy functions to run on your Mac.

Louis Perez will give another installment of his popular "Magical Mystery Tour of the Web", which showcases a collection of interesting websites on a given topic. This month's tour will focus on "Cool Tech" - new gadgets for the home, office, etc. including must haves.

Plus we'll discuss all of the latest Apple news and have our "Question & Answer" session where our experts will try to solve your problems.

As always, a meeting you won't want to miss! Hope to see you all there!

About NJMUG: 

The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (NJMUG) is open to all persons, whether they are a current or future Macintosh user. An individual membership in NJMUG costs $30.00 per year. If you are thinking of becoming an NJMUG member but would like to check the group out first, we allow non-members to attend two meetings as a "guest". Once you become a member of NJMUG you are entitled to attend all monthly meetings as well as gain access to all of the member benefits including member discounts on hardware and software, free USB flash drive, monthly distribution files, and eligibility in all raffles and member giveaways.  Check www.njmug.org for more information.

Ian, Mark, Tania, Jessica, and hundreds of other "young professionals" are sleeping out on the street this March so that homeless kids don't have to.

Covenant House is a great organization that shelters homeless kids aged 16-24 and helps them attain jobs and education so they will land on their feet once they're out of the program.

results.description:
The NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group Is Accepting New Members

The NYC Atheists’ Advanced Writers Group, now going for two years, is open to talented writers who want the support and camaraderie of other secular writers in polishing their work and getting happily published.  Our group meets once a month; we gently critique each other’s work, but our main focus is on helping each other get published. There is no charge for this workshop; we ask only that you commit to meeting once a month, reading the work of the other members and offering your suggestions for improvement in an upbeat, encouraging manner.

What do we mean by “advanced writers?”

We mean those writers who are close to being published or have already been published in some form. We also mean writers who, we can see by reading samples of their writing, have great potential but until now have not been mentored or encouraged to treat their work seriously or to aim for publication.

How do you know if you fit our criteria for a writer with promise?

You don’t.  Writers are often poor judges of the level of their talent. We suggest that you give us the opportunity to judge that, because we can often sense that spark of talent even if you yourself do not.  Additionally, we have recently instituted a new member category, dubbed “Apprentice author”--individuals who demonstrate potential but who have not yet been published anywhere or achieved commercial capability.

Submit a Sample

If you are interested in joining this kind of a close and involved group of writers, submit a sample of your writing (15 pages or less) to the group,plus a personal letter telling us a little about your background, what you are aiming for and what you think we can do for you. Your sample submission may be a play, fiction or non-fiction. If fiction, it can be a short story or a chapter of a book.  If non-fiction, the sample can be an article or a chapter of a non-fiction book. If a play, send only Act One.

If you are accepted into the group, we ask only that you encourage and support each group member by reading his or her material, critiquing it in a kindly, professional manner and attend our monthly meeting to discuss it in a group setting. There is no charge whatsoever for membership in the Advanced Writers Group.  Our goal is to encourage more good secular writers to enter the literary marketplace.

Bear in mind that once you are accepted, everyone in the group accepts that you are headed for publication; this is not a “learn to write” group. This is a group whose members have shown themselves to have solid skills and need only minimum critiquing or, more importantly, encouragement in tackling the publishing industry, which, when done alone, can be discouraging. We are there as friends, as your cheerleaders, your mentors, your colleagues.

Jane Everhart, Facilitator  NYCA Advanced Writers Group

NYC ATHEISTS CONTACT: [masked]

TO APPLY, PLEASE SEND A SAMPLE OF YOUR WRITING (15 pages or less) plus a brief bio and a letter telling us what you think we can do for you, to:

NYC Atheists Advanced Writers Group                                                                                                c/o NYC Atheists Inc.                                                                                                                        Box 6060 NY, NY[masked]

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
In January, we celebrated the anniversary of Roe v. Wade by doing a consciousness-raising (CR) on when we have needed birth control and abortion. In February, we built on January's CR by testifying about our decisions to have children or not and analyzing the common struggles that women voiced at the meeting (e.g., impact on career, costs of child care, quality of life). In March we will continue to build on these CRs by reading and discussing a radical feminist solution to the system-wide challenges of raising children that fall mainly on women. 

During this month's meeting, we will read <a>Beyond the Family Wage: A Women'sLiberation View of the Social Wage by Kathie Sarachild </a>and through discussion questions, process our thoughts surrounding this piece and how it relates to the testimony of women from our January and February meetings. We will also be brainstorming ideas for future actions. 

"Our women's liberation gains have been more circumscribed than those in other countries, where child care, family leave, and housing, not to mention health care, are much more affordable and otherwise accessible." -Kathy Sarachild

<a>The Commons</a> in Brooklyn, 388 Atlantic Avenue between Hoyt and Bond, near the Hoyt-Schermerhorn Street A/C/G. You can also take the 2,3,4,5 to Nevins or the D,N,R to Atlantic-Pacific. <a>Map</a>

We meet the Third Tuesday of every month: Tues March 15th, Tues April 19th and Tues 19th May. Save the dates!
results.name: Raising Children: A Critical Discussion of the Unpaid Labor of Parenting

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 3 spots besides myself for this meetup. Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 3 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 3 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: Seasonal American fare & a drink list strong on French wines & globally accented cocktails.

http://www.theeddynyc.com/


RSVPs: Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event. 

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.

results.description: February 15, 2016/Brooklyn, NY – When learning how to survive and stay safe is not enough, a group of “at-risk” students in Laventille, the most notorious and violent neighborhood in Trinidad’s capital city Port-of-Spain, are selected for an urban art project that blossoms into a two-year process of these young people receiving guidance on how to use the arts to share their personal stories with their community, and ultimately the entire world. Their experiences are reflected in Art Connect, an equally powerful and moving documentary from Spanish director Miquel Galofré and producer Charlotte Elias.

results.description:
Come on out to the Tara Hill Irish Tavern for a bluegrass jam.

This jam is for all level of players.  There will be a mix of traditional instruments and any uke players who come from this group.

Bring a song to share.  It's best if you have at least some printouts of the music.  Traditionally at a bluegrass jam people take turns leading the songs.  If you don't have any bluegrass songs other country or folk songs fit too. 

If you don't have a song or don't want to lead, that's ok too. 

In case you were thinking that you don't play much bluegrass, come anyway!  Most bluegrass is pretty easy to play. 

The plan is to do these jams every first and third Tuesday of the month.

Email me for more info:  [masked]

See you there!
results.name: Bluegrass jam (ukes and traditional instruments invited)

results.description:
West Caldwell, N.J. – Men of all ages are invited to participate in free singing lessons provided through the Dapper Dans of Harmony, Essex County’s premiere men’s chorus.
Ready, Set, Sing! Will be taught by the members of Gimme Four; an Internationally Competitive quartet; ranked in the top twenty in the world and members of the Dapper Dans of Harmony.
Give us six Tuesday evenings, and we’ll give you the skills you need to experience all the fun of solo or group singing.
Classes run Tuesdays at 7:30 p.m. for one hour each from March 1, 2016 until April 5, 2016 at the West Caldwell Civic Center, 5 Fairfield Ave, West Caldwell, NJ 07006. Singers of all skill levels and experience are invi...ted and all learning materials are free.
You don’t even need to be able to read music, we will teach you everything you need to know to sing richly and with resonance to produce ear-pleasing harmony. Our participants will quickly be producing beautiful harmony without the aid of a piano and in the company of a great bunch of fellow singers.
Everyone sings; whether it is in church, in the car, or in the shower, people have a natural desire to express themselves in song. However, many of us are unsure about singing in front of others. Through this program, the Dans want to help men get the most beautiful sound possible from their voice.
Advance registrations are appreciated, while walk-ins will be welcome. Contact the group at[masked] or [masked] to register or for more information.
The Dapper Dans of Harmony are part of the 24,000-member Barbershop Harmony Society and meet Tuesdays at the West Caldwell Civic Center and new singers are always welcome. Go to dapperdans.org to learn more about the group.
Ready, Set, Sing!
What: Free singing lessons courtesy of the Dapper Dans of Harmony
Where: West Caldwell Civic Center, 5 Fairfield Ave., West Caldwell NJ. Just look for the big clock!
When: Tuesdays at 7:30 p.m. from 3/1/16 until 4/5/16
To register please contact us at[masked] or [masked].

results.description:
Everyone said they had a good time, so let's do it again.

If you're  looking to get out and try something different, may I suggest coming out and playing Trivia Quiz.

We have had a very nice group of regulars that have been participating and are always looking for more people to join us.

It is free to play and there is no Meetup fee for this event. So give it a try. And if you're coming right from work The Garth Road Inn does serve food...very Reasonable and Good.

The Garth Road Inn has been serving the Scarsdale community for many years.  It's comfortable, affordable & centrally located.


**There will be a prize for the winning team!**


And there will also be bonus questions where a team can win stuff!!

Bring your friends or you can join other Meetup members to form a team.

It's a great opportunity to use all that information you have acquired over the years.  *_*

There will be an entertaining mix of questions!

Let's get those brain cells working & have some FUN!!!

There are 5 rounds
Questions are read off and each team writes down the answers....it's a team effort!

****All are welcome to attend!****


And there are always people from the Pub itself playing, we will be joining in on the FUN!

I look forward to seeing you there! *_*
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me when you arrive.
results.name: Trivia Quiz Night @ The Garth Road Inn in Scarsdale

results.description:
If you are learning English or if you are a native speaker of English, join us for relaxed conversation and to make new friends! All levels are welcome!

This meetup is perfect for: 
-Students that want to improve their speaking & pronunciation 
-New arrivals to the U.S. 
-People looking to make new friends, discuss and learn about language & culture

Topics we are open to discussing 
-Weather 
-Hobbies 
-News 
-Politics 
-Anything you want to talk about

Aspects of English we focus on 
-Speaking: Pronunciation, Accents 
-Listening: Definitions, Vocabulary, Synonyms 
-Slang, common ways Americans express themselves

This venue has food such as pastas, salads and sandwiches. They also sell Beer, coffee & normal drinks for very cheap!

Please only sign up if you are serious about attending, we remove members that do not honor their RSVP! 
It will be $2 to join

Write what your native language is in the comments section
results.name: Conversation practice

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
We know from Flint and Detroit, Michigan, Hoosick Falls, NY and SO many other places that you can't always trust the government to protect the drinking water.

Listen to the next Eco-Logic to hear a discussion with a panel of experts.
Just how bad are thing really?
What can be done about it?
What IS being done about it?

My guests will be Ruth Caplan and Nancy Price from the Alliance for Democracy and Susan Shapiro from the Radiation and Public Health Project.WBAI, 99.5FM within 90 miles of NYC and www.wbai.org

For more info: www.ecoradio.org
results.name: Protect drinking water!

results.description:
From Twerking to learning how to Dougie, and everything in between, participants will enjoy learning new moves while making new friends in a social and energetic atmosphere!

Whether you are preparing for that wedding party, going out with your friends, or because it's a weeknight and you want to change it up; every class we offer has new material allowing you to consistently learn and develop. 

For more information& tickets: https://goo.gl/M9E5RA
results.name: Twerk to Dougie and Everything In-between!

results.description:
O'Connors has a great Trivia game going every Tuesday. Tom always has challenging and diverse questions, and our team frequently wins! The game starts at 8:30, so let's try to arrive around 8 to hang out a bit before it starts. Come to win a drink or two, make some new friends, see old ones, and play a fun and intellectually stimulating game of trivia!

Great times and great friends!  New and returning members welcome!
results.name: Trivia Night!

results.description:
The March Dinner and Discussion will both be held at the Versailles Diner. Dinner is at 6:30 PM. The discussion is at 8:00 PM. You can make the discussion without having dinner, although if you attend only the discussion, you should order something (coffee and dessert is fine) to help support the Versailles.

Everything you know is wrong. That is the subtext of this discussion. Here are three examples of people discovering the truth of their reality in three different media. Film: in THE MATRIX we have Neo learning that he is living in a VR world and that his body is actually hooked up to a mechanical pod. Television: in "For the World Is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky," an episode of the original STAR TREK series, the inhabitants learn that they are actually living in a hollowed-out asteroid. Fiction: in Isaac Asimov's classic story, Nightfall, a race living on a multiple sun solar system learns that the universe is infinitely bigger than they imagined when a once-in-a-millennium eclipse unveils the night sky.

Dinner & Discussion is held on the third Tuesday of the month (except December). Here's a list of topics we've discussed in the past:

https://sites.google.com/site/sfassnofbergencounty/home/discussions-and-other-activities/topic-discussion-group


If you have an interest in science fiction / fantasy / horror, please contact me directly at SFABCPhilmu (at) gmail.com to learn about lots of other north Jersey events.
results.name: Discuss Conceptual Breakthroughs / Paradigm Shifts in SF

group.name: The Morristown Movie & Dining Meetup Group!

results.description:
Register at http://www.GirlTalkandCocktails.com to get login details to our LIVE online event. Don't worry, if you can't make it you'll get access to the replays.

Each week for the next few weeks will cover 2 of the 12 modules that are part of the Get REAL, Get Love Group Coaching program. Live weekly, Tuesdays at 8PM (ET)
results.name: Get REAL, Get Love is on Girl Talk & Cocktails Blab!

results.description:
Join us every Tuesday at 8:30pm as La Luz hosts an ALL LEVELS, OPEN,  DROP-IN Improv Comedy Class!!!

We begin the class with a focus on group activities and fun games as we  move towards some individual character building, short and long form scenes, listening, supporting our partner(s), and performing in front an audience.

Each week is a bit different with various teachers from Upright Citizens Brigade, Magnet Theater, the PIT and places all over the world! Every instructor is a new experience and want our students to have a dynamic well rounded learning experience.

Classes are donation based so please come anyway. We ask $10-13.

Now get on over to La Luz and Let’s Play!!!!
results.how_to_find_us: We are on 135 Thames St. 11237 btwn Porter Ave & Varick, across from the GHETTY gas station and flushing AVE! just one block from the Loom! Take the Jefferson L (1 long block) or Morgan L (about 5-6 blocks)!!
results.name: Improv Comedy CLASS every TUES @ 830pm in Bushwick Brooklyn 11237!

results.description:
Daniela is hosting a second bra top fitting on Tuesday after the Central Park Training Run. 

We are working out final details with Oiselle, but we anticipate the cost of these tops to be $60-$68 (definitely no more than $68). There may be additional perks from Oiselle, TBD. 

If you think you're interested in getting one, please feel free to come by and test out a sample. We know bra fit can be highly personal, so this is why we've requested samples. 

Also: these 3/4 tops are designed so that you can potentially layer over your favorite sports bra, if you need more support. If that's the case, please be sure to bring your favorite sports bra with you, for fitting purposes. 

See you there!
results.name: Sports Bra Fitting II

results.description:
We're opening up decisions for challenges to the group! Join your fellow Think Tankers and organizers for coffee after this upcoming Tuesday's event - we'll be deciding on the 2 challenge topics for the months of April and May.

Typically we take suggestions during events themselves and in random conversations with Tankers, but this is a more structured approach that will let your voice be heard in a dedicated place. I'm excited to hear everyone's ideas!

The organizers and I will come with a list of suggested topics based on our network, areas of expertise, and what we think is up-and-coming in the world of technology and global challenge. But we need input from the GROUP! There are so many amazing things happening in the city and beyond which we can explore over the course of 30 days.

You're more than welcome to come to this event even if you're not attending the Think Tank - we'll be meeting in a different location down the street, so it's a separate open forum for the group.

See you there!

-Dan & the Think Tank Team (Mike, Kevin, Brendan, and Mikayla)
results.name: Decide On Challenge Topics For April & May

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
